text: I use to go to this place every time I came to LasVegas but,I went there on March 29th,and got the Salt Pepper Lobster,and the waiter brought a parcel lobster and tried to pass it off as a whole lobster! When I question him on the rest of the lobster,naturally he got upset because I caught him trying to scam us! Needless to say we will not go back to this place again!

Food was mediocre.  Beef with oyster sauce and salt and pepper pork were my two favorite dishes here. General Tao and ginger chicken were not great. Service was ok, the ladies speak minimal English. On the upside, our food came out quick. Also, the dim sum part was good. Think ill come back solely for Dim sim next time.

If I could give a half of a star I would and that is being generous. We ordered dim sum and regular menu items and it was hands down the worst Chinese food I have ever had in my whole life...and no I'm not being melodramatic. The dim sum was rubbery and had a gelatinous layer covering it and nothing we ate had any seasoning in it. We ordered the fish fillet and my husband bit into something hard that can only be described as rock-like. To top off the disappointing meal, the service was horrible because we had to ask multiple times for everything from our waters to a clean spoon. At the end of our disastrous meal we got handed a $90 bill for food that we didn't even really eat. I begrudgingly paid the $90 and chose not to leave a tip because of the lackluster service and the fact that the manager/owner completely ignored our comments about the quality of food, and after all of that the waitress had the nerve to ask me where her tip was. Needless to say we will never be coming back!

My husband & I were here a little while ago, it was early in the morning, probably about 9ish. We were craving roast duck & dim sum. When we arrived we were greeted and seated,  there were just a few people working we were offered several types of appetizers, we only accepted the dim sum, after about 10 minutes we asked for menus because they didn't hand them to us, a lady took our order; we ordered half a roast duck & steamed rice, as we waited the little carts kept rolling, and rolling, we ate our dim sum and waited for the duck, 45 minutes later we began to feel anxious, we didn't receive a " it'll be here soon" or " we apologize for the wait" NOTHING.. I say let's wait until the hour, we'll ask what's going on, so we did! After that one lady came near and asked if we were ready to place our order?! We said we already did and showed her the copy of the order & she said oh we're not serving duck at this time... ?!?! We were very upset, the lady who took the order in the first place should have said that to begin with, there was no communication between the employees, they didn't even apologize instead they handed us a check for the drinks and the dim sum. I can say after service like that I will not return to this place.

This was honestly the worst restaurant I have ever been to. I went with my parents and my mom's plate was dirty. It took them until after we were halfway through our meal to even get us our drinks. The staff going around seemed very disorganized and very unprofessional. The food wasn't even all that great. The first thing you see when you walk in is a very dirty fish tank. It was so dirty and green that you couldn't even see the fish unless they were right up against the glass. The whole restaurant felt extremely dirty and gross. And after finishing my meal, I noticed stuck pieces of dried food on the inside of my water cup, as well as some floating around in the water. Definitely will not be coming back.
I won't ever go back to this place! Dirty food, Bad customer service, The employees aren't friendly nor nice at all!!! What a shame!

Compared to the Bay Area dim sum standards, this place is just alright. But, when you are away and had a long night of partying with a hang over, this place hits the spot! Your basic dim sum and reasonable prices. Too bad the cab ride from Aria to Harbor Palace costs $20 in itself!
Something is terribly wronging the kitchen lately. Used to be good place to have decent dinner. That is all I can say.

I went to this place a week ago, and I would say, it took around 1 hour for me food to be ready.   There were a lot of people that came all at once to the restaurant and for some reason they were able to get their food quick as hell, while my family waited patiently an hour for our food.   Moreover the waiters did not check up on our tables like they did with others. I felt as if I was constantly ignored.   Food was alright. Customer service-  lets me honest - was horrific! They barely had any common customer courtesy.   If you're a tourist finding some food around China Town, #1 rule - and I mean it - don't go to this place! You'll be waiting until the sun goes down for your food! Go somewhere else and get some pho. There's better restaurants out there than this piece of crap.   Thank you for reading!   ?????

This place is awesome! Authentic Cantonese style Chinese food, the way I like it! Prices aren't ridiculous like the Capital Seafood Restaurant in the same plaza. I've only ordered takeout from here, but just found out that they are open until 5 am! Definitely gonna have to try dining in next time.. Perfect time for me to practice my Cantonese!

We love dim sum and our most favorites are in SF. We got to this one by accident and it was pretty good we even got some bao with chicken in taste we never has. We also order cod fish ala carta which was excellent. The service was good and even few that spoke reasonable English.

The flavors are great here but the portions are small and the food gets cold really fast. Dim sum never tastes good cold. They put a ton of flowers on the tea so it's really dark, even after adding more water. The bean curd it perfect though. The tofu is really smooth and it has the perfect amount of sweetness. Great for a quick dim sum fix.

I went to try this place during my trip to Vegas.  It was horrible.  The food was brought out like 10-15 minutes apart making each dish cold.  It was just way too slow and there weren't that many people in there.  The food itself is okay.  I will not go to this place ever again.

Past 8pm late dinner last night, 6/5/15. So hungry so prepared to order. I was not particularly satisfied last February visit but craving for Chinese so we decided to give it another try. Ordered Hong Kong Style Seafood Pan Fried Noodles, Mongolian Beef, Salt & Pepper Squid, and Dim Sum to try (pot stickers, chives dumpling & beef ribs). It didn't take long and within minutes our order served one by one - so glad cz we we were starving! Food was good and surprised to say that this time around, service was decent. It must be because the place is not that packed. Our servers were fast to request for water refills, etc - place overall decently clean/presentable. The man who initially took our order actually came back towards the end to ask if everything wz ok ... that never happened before in any of our previous visits. Again, maybe because it wasn't as packed, but hopefully it stays that way. We'll come back again to enjoy good food ... next time we'll order "duck".

Ive been coming here for years and this place is alright. Not the best I have ever eaten but not the worst either.  I usually come here late at night or in the morning/early afternoon. Late night I usually order a fried rice.  Either the Yang Chow, BBQ pork or the salty fish and chicken fried rice. I also usually get an entree like fish with black bean sauce, fried pork chop with salt and pepper, fish with spicy salt and pepper or a soup like the won ton or the hot and sour soup. All the above dishes are pretty decent flavor wise. Good enough for 3am as far as im concerned.  The other times I goto this place are in the early afternoon for dim sum. Last time I went for dim sum they had the carts rollin around as usual. I have never had to fill out any type of paperwork to eat dim sum at this place. The dim sum is decent. I usually get sesame balls, pork bun, shumai, harcow, and chicken feet. All pretty standard in terms of flavor. Nothing really stands out or lets me down.  The service not bad at all. I have been eating at Chinese food joints for over 30 years from Hong Kong to Thailand to San Francisco to New York to Jakarta....you get the idea. All that "Asian folks are so well mannered and polite" is some stereotype junk. These cats wanna know what you want to eat and drink and thats it. Dont expect any type of convo/banter especially if you dont speak the same language.  Lots of folks mistake cultural differences for bad attitudes. Dont get it twisted folks. We all have bad days and good days. Maybe I got it all wrong but then again im not an over sensitive attention monster.  Food: B - Step up your food game guys, dont get complacent. Service: B - Train your employees to handle problems better. Cleanliness: C - You really need to do a complete cleaning of the store Overall: B-/C+ - I will continue to eat here just wish they would improve.  This place aint as bad as people are saying. All the basics for a great Chinese restaurant are there. Management just needs to remember that they have to try and improve every single day...

Awesome food! I really like their black sesame chicken and their pan fried noodle dish. Couldn't stop digging in! My friend took me here for some late night dinner, and we were both starving. We were more than satisfied and left with an eminent food coma. Has a lot of potential!

I really enjoy the way they still serve dim sum the old fashioned way carrying them around with the steam carts. The quality is also very good, I especially like the siu mai and BBQ pork buns. Overall a great place for some authentic Chinese food and great dim sum :)

Worst service ever! One word RUDE! This place use to be so good, busy, great customer service, not anymore. Went on a Sunday around 1pm and no wait (which I thought it was weird because from what I remember there's always a wait) there were only 5 other groups. Dim sum was horrible and cold and apparently they ran out of everything. Eveything was dirty; table cloths, plates, utensils, cups, everything had to be taken back for a new set. And if you needing anything no one other then your server could help u everyone else will ignore you. Horrible!!
Best dimsum! Yea right. Not a best place to get dimsum. Taste awful, and very expensive.

This is the dirtiest place to eat Chinese food ever!  We sat down we saw the bowls  and the spoons on our table still have left over rices. One of our water cup has a yellow ring inside and i was able to remove it easily a straw, not sure what it was so we left that cup if water alone!. Either the health inspectors in Las Vegas are too gamblely or they always been doing a lousy inspection job!!

2.5  Most of us would agree: At 3 AM, just about anything you put in your mouth tastes pretty good.  Tired and hungry, I was more than happy to let my chinese dining companions order. Many of our desired dishes were actually not on the menu but  the owner was more than willing to accomodate. Just keep in mind that you may be paying a bit of a premium for your special requests, like $14 for a bowl of rice porridge! Holy rip-off for rice porridge, Batman!

Went there for lunch, everything started out fine. The check came out around $30 and I gave the server $100 bill to pay for it. I can see the server handing the cashier the money and her giving the change back,  he pockets the $70 change and leaves to smoke in front of the restaurant . OH HELL NO!!! I run up to the cashier, explain to her what happen, she didn't speak a word of english and  now im using a calculator t explain that the server TOOK MY MONEY,  thinking i just tipped him over 50%... so the man server comes back in and now im yelling at him that he took my money and he's yelling me that I tipped him 70 bucks and its his.... Wooo SA ...  I made a scene and got my change back..

Ordered dim sum for take out. When I arrived, two of three items were unavailable. I asked for two other substitute items. Also unavailable. Why did you even take my order when you are out of what I asked for?!? Next time, save me a trip.

Horrible service. Waitress didn't understand the order. Dirty. No paper towels in bathroom. They didn't wash their cups before they gave them to us. Had nasty residue on the bottom. Disgusting never coming here again.

One of the worst places I have ever been to. The service is horrific and the server named Chuong is terrible. I made 3 simple requests and he still could not carry it out. The food is decent. Would not recommend, not getting your money's worth.

This is my first time using Yelp.  I read the Harbor Palace reviews and almost didn't come.  I am a USA citizen that works for a Chinese Company.  I eat Authentic Chinese Food all the time both in China and USA with my Chinese colleagues.  For those that wrote poor reviews probably due to you not appreciating authentic Chinese.  You don't order chow Mein here.  You order authentic food!  The food is awesome!  2nd time this week!
Worst service, workers speaking loud on their phone, flies all over, workers don't speak english, unable to use their own coupon, food sucked.

The food was horrible!  First, the Cheung Fun (rice noodle rolls) were hard.  Second, the lady was asking if I wanted Siu Mai and I said yes.  The Siu Mais came with no wraps and they tasted awful.  Later on, I saw the real Siu Mai with wraps and ordered.  They tasted bad too cuz they were sour!!!  but they were the usually Siu Mai I eat.  I asked the lady about the ones without the wraps, she said those were Crystal Siu Mais.  The first lady didn't tell me about it.
first time I came here for lunch with my aunt had dimsums and seaame balls before heading to cali by bus. then it became my fave spot because of their buchi. next dine was with my friends, good food.

So, I never write reviews, but I had to.  Avoid this restaurant!  The food was bland and just not good. I've had better take-out Chinese food. Checked in to get the free egg rolls. They were extremely oily and not tasty.  Again, avoid this restaurant. It's not worth your money let alone your time. Oh, I agree with the other reviews. The service is lukewarm.

Excellent Cantonese seafood and meats. Very generous portions and very reasonably priced. All Chinese clientele knows this is a place to get authentic.  Also, service was wonderful.  Manager even added an egg and scallion dish at no cost because "he thought we'd like it".    Be smart about ordering. Consider their strengths  and take the time to see what the Chinese customers are ordering. You'll have a very memorable meal.

I've been here a few times with my family but thats because we didnt know of any other places for dim sum. Here are a few of my complaints: 1) they charge for hot tea when most places dont. 2) not all of the food is served hot even though you see steam rising from the pans. 3) some of the food carts just pass you by without even acknowledging you as a table waiting to see what food is available. 4) you dont really get much service here.   I think Im gonna try to find new places for dim sum next time im in vegas.

I came here around 10AM, and only about 3 other tables were occupied. You can pretty much seat yourself, and all the waitresses are nice. The ladies pushing the carts were actually polite, too! Of all the dimsum places I've been to, the waiters have always been pretty rude.  The dim sum was pretty good! Just like other typical dimsum places. I had it so often in my childhood, I kind of lost appreciation for it.  I really liked their pineapple bun filled with custard. So delicious! It was a new alternative that I hadn't had before.  Their fried dough ball coated in sesame seeds with the ground black sesame filling is amazing! Crunch & crispy on the outside, soft and doughy on the inside. I totally blanked out on what this dish is called in Chinese... lol sorry.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would definitely come here for dimsum when I'm in Vegas.
Food taste good.  Portion is very small.  There is almost no service but charge 18% tip - this is not right!!!
The food was very tasty, and the dim sum was well-priced. Pork bun was my fave. Service was decent. Def worth it when in chinatown, and worth the trip if you're craving it!
Love the food, place is old and out date, little dirty, service is not that great...

Absolutely no customer service!! The waiter doesn't even offer a greeting just rudely asks what we want and then quickly walks away before we can finish what we're saying. Food is just ok. Decor is outdated. Definitely will not come back here. Good luck getting the checked. Waved down the server but they ignored us. Not that we wanted to pay for this awful experience.

I had Dim Sum here with my family and it was really good. The service was also real good. It seem like all the waiters and waitresses came every minute or so to check up on us. The Dim Sum was pretty good too.  This place you NEED to check up especially if you are with a whole group and is looking for some Dim Sum for breakfast.

Very good Dim Sum. Some of the food was warm at best.   The rest was hot and fresh. I don't know why people are giving bad reviews.  I'm Chinese and it was fine to me. I've read bad reviews about the bathrooms...  They are "Circus Circus" clean bathrooms NOT Mandalay Bay bathrooms which is fine for a small restaurant. The people are very nice and polite. The prices are a bit on the high side compared to other places but I am not from the area or state so I cannot comment on the cost of living.  I had hot tea but asked for cokeS for my wife and daughter and they knew to bring forks for them.  Overall they have good food and good service, but prices on the high side. There were 3 of us and the bill was $60+. However I did have some take home so you could subtract about $8 of it...  I also went a bit overboard since I have not had Dim Sum in quite awhile.

As I had mentioned earlier, I finally moved to LV. Unfortunately for me, I caught a bug or virus or something (will sleep it off after this review) on the drive down here. Wanted something from HP, but nothing too greasy.   When I was inching past Hoover Dam, I thought, "Why not won ton mein?" (For those who don't know, it's thin noodles with won tons and some bok choy in chicken broth.) Not the most complex, but it satisfied a need. Asked for some char siu (boneless spareribs), and dinner was complete.   Oh, and they did update the place ...   by putting a solar-blocking shade on the windows. Small steps before big steps.

Food: 4 out of 5 stars. Everything else: 0 out of 5 stars.  The food was good. The service was horrendous. We had made a reservation for 20 people after my cousin's wedding, they only sat down 1/3 of us and gave other tables to other people. Once my group finally sat down 20 minutes later, my table of 9 waited 20 minutes to put in our order (we couldn't catch the waitress because she kept running around and wouldn't listen to us) and then we waited 1 hour to get our food. We were so hungry, we finished our 6 plates of food in 15 minutes. What a lame way to spend our post-wedding dinner! So sad haha. The busser was more on top of it than our waitress. 6 out of 9 spoons we were given had visible food stains--when we asked out waitress for new ones, she seemed confused and in disbelief. Everyone else around us got their food well before us, even though they sat down after us. When we asked our waitress where our food was and if we could talk to a manager, she shook her head and mumbled something and ran away from our table. We asked another passing waiter the same thing, to which he laughed nervously and said "No manager" and also ran away. Not sure if he meant "No I'm not letting you talk to my manager" or "No there is no manager here, you fools." Which it would be easy to believe that there was no manager because clearly this place was unmanaged and poorly run.  Don't waste your time with this place, the food was good but the service makes it completely not worth it. I'm the LEAST picky/bourgeois person and this place was so ridiculously awful I had to leave this review.

we came here laate at night, so i didnt expect the food to be too good. oh well, we didnt really want to keep searching for restaurants at 11 PM. you cant argue with the prices here, if you order the combo with like 6 dishes. the food was ehh, average. everything was cooked well, but the flavors werent too good. i dont think its THAT bad, i can imagine myself giving this place maybe 4 stars during regular dinner time IF the customer service was a little better
Holy eff I am gonna get started writing a review about this shit hole. Do not waste your time on this palce. Everytime you ask for something it is like a problem.

We had a lot of fun here and went twice in one week.   Dim Sum was the reason we were here.  We enjoyed all they had to offer on their Dim Sum menu.  All the food was great and prices were exceptional.   If you are traveling with a group, this is so much easier and cheaper.  The staff was friendly, Restaurant was clean, coupled with the great food and service - what more could you want!!!!!!

Horrible!!!! Horrible food and service too!!! Ordered chicken poridge, the chicken was smelled!! Dimsum its just ok..i could make better than that. And talking about the service?! While we still eating with full of food on the table they gave us the bill already, really??!!  And right before we left the waiter yelled at us asking "u dont give me a tip??" We did left tip on the table, she dont even check it just yelled and asked us! Very very rude! Never ever in my life will back to this place again!!! Neveeerrrrrrr!!!!

Don't come here! Worst Dim Sum in town...everything was super greasy and didn't taste good. Some of the dishes seems like it was from yesterday. The (Hum Sui Kok) was greasy, soggy and not crispy. Would not come back here again.

Have been coming here for more than 10 years and the place had not change so much. We always come here when we are in town after church before heading back to California or late nights after drinking. Dimsum cart is our favorite specially the shrimp hargow, shrimp fried rice,  fish or from legs congee and steamed Chicken.
If I could give no star I would and it how bad this place is.   totally disappointed.    service was bad, I mean bad.  No greeting, no smile and just in the hurry want my money.

Horrible experience. First time I go and was not happy. First the waiter got mad when we told him it was a party of 12 and they did not want to join the tables which we said we didnt mind them being seperate. Then we are ready to order our drinks and they were not waiting for everyone to order so they kept coming back and forth and what trully ruined the night was the last thing they did. THEY ARE VERY RUDE . I was ordering the entrees and asked how the dinner special worked and told them to give me a second since i was translating for my in law. She said i cant wait for you ,now you wait for me and i said ok. Made sure the whole table new what they wanted and when i said excuse me we are ready this time, she completely went passed us and ignored my party so we left. Then she went outside and thought we can come back inside and since she was ready for us but Like really you had one other table aside from us . DONT TELL ME YOU WERE BUSY! unless you are patient dont  go here. I cant tell you if the food was at all good because we didnt make it that far.

This place is really on top of things. I love the food here, and actually this place is really great for family dinners. It's great! Waiters/waitresses were on top of taking care of us (we were a group of about 12) and great at taking dishes that were finished to get it out of our way.  Definitely coming back here for a family event.
The food was horrible! I ordered the seafood fried rice. It came with some imitation seafood...chewy and disgusting! Never going back there again!

The Place: Older, Didn't seem that Clean The Service: Rude / Slow... Even though they weren't busy. Food took awhile to come out.  The Food: The food was ok. Portions were not that great for Family Style Chinese Food. The menu stated a charge of $1.50 for a glass of water. (Though I wasn't charged for it)   Wouldn't Go Again
This place is gross. I'm sure they can't pass a health inspection. I think the food is not fresh and the service is bad too. Dirty shabby place.  Go to the golden nugget for sim sum.

I checked into this restaurant without going through the reviews from Yelp. That was a total mistake on my part. I was visiting Vegas and went to a grocery mall and I saw this dim sum restaurant nearby with beautiful pics of dim sum posted on the window. Due to convenience, I checked into this restaurant and ordered some dim sum.  The quality of the dim sum was sub par and I totally regret not checking out current reviews on Yelp. Dim sum there did not taste good, quality was not good and in such a highly populated Chinese community in Vegas. The problem is that it's expensive. I would not mind paying more for quality and good dim sum, but not on this restaurant. I used yelp review to find a close to 4 stars review on a dim sum place in Vegas called Chang's Hong Kong cuisine, dim sum there was undoubtedly much better than this restaurant. Always check for reviews from yelp first before trying a restart out, or you will regret.

Horrible place. Not happy about this selection a couple of weeks ago.  The service was horrific.  Rude and impatient staff.  Price is weird and they charge you for everything.  Not recommended at all.

Okay, so, obviously Harbor Palace is not the best Chinese in the city.  Most of their dishes are so-so, some are revolting, but a few are memorable (braised sea bass in a hot pot = get it NOW).   Their menu is extensive when in comes to the seafood.  Abalone, shark fin, geoduck clams, lobster, crab, they got it!    I will beat you, however, if you order the honey walnut shrimp.  Picture Long John Silver's fried shrimp topped with room-temperature, Kroger mayonnaise.  Yep, that's their "famous" honey walnut shrimp! I'm still hunting down the person that recommended it to me.    Also, be warned that their waitstaff may or may not mistreat you.  I personally enjoy rude Chinese restaurant waitstaff but you may not.  They get three stars  simply because their staff are extra grumpy.  Really, I love brusque waiters.  P.S. - If you're a glutton for punishment, get their frequent diner card.  You'll get coupons for free food (I guess, if you want it...).

I ordered for delivery. I don't know if they do the same awful foods like that for eating in the restaurant. The vegetable under the walnut shrimp has gone bad, and it only have 3 small walnuts inside. The general sao's chicken is bitter?and the broccoli inside is yellow.  And they are all more expensive than other restaurants. Do not eat here!
Terrible terrible service. Worn down uncomfortable booth seats, not many dim sum carts and restroom pretty messy. Good luck,

Ok here we go! Stumbled upon this place and what a great find. Simply put, delicious. I am not a huge fan of dim sum but could tell by looking at it that it's authentic. Ordered off the menu, beef with oyster sauce, wor wonton soup, combo fried rice, mu shu pork all fantastic. My new go to Chinese restaurant.

I've been eating here for years.  I make it a point to stop in when I'm in town.  Yes, the carpet is old but I'm not here for the carpet.  Yes, this is a "typical" Chinese joint.  Forget the aesthetics.   I'm here for the food.  I've been here for both the Dim Sum and for dinners.  This last trip (6/9/16) was for dinner.  We had the salt & pepper squid.  It was cooked and seasoned to perfection.  House stir fried noodles and stir fried chives tips... yummy.  The clams in black bean sauce was tasty.  If you want fresh seafood, give this place a try.  Don't bother trying this place if you expect 5 star service, you won't get it.  I want fresh and I want yummy.  Must try!!

This restaurant had a rather high rating which I thought would impress my asian elders on our recent trip to Vegas.     I've been here in the late hours to eat peking duck which wasn't bad, but wasn't great.     Then I decided to bring a party of 17 to this restaurant for dim sum on Sunday and made reservations.     I was asked why I chose this place as everyone was disappointed that the food was not that great.     It's hard to explain, but it's just hmm...  Service was good.   But the food just didn't seem up to par.   Was it bad?   Not really... but it wasn't good.     The place we used to go to on decataur which tends to change ownership or names every time we visit (yearly or longer) that I thought I would check this out.     The other place had poor selection of dim sum vs. this place, but the food was tastier, hot, etc.   Here is was just... average.  So I hope the rating drops below the 4 stars because this is not above average and while I would go there again... I must protest their dim sum is not the best and what's funny is that the elders I brought would have rather gone to the restaurant with less selection and packed.  I rather enjoyed not having to fight to get food, but oh well... relaying the message of the party of 17 so that Yelp gives a better or accurate score.    (Yes, you have to assume that I know what I'm talking about :^P)
I was very impressed with the dim sum at this restaurant.  The food was very good, the service was very good, and my family and I left very satisfied. We will most definitely be returning.
very nasty food and service,,, house fried rice taste like poh poh and fish entree is a no no...overall a nasty place and oh receipt is all in chinese and has no breakdown.....

Literally the best dimsum place I've ever had! Great options and the food tastes great! The service can be slow and the ambiance isn't the best but it's really low key and definitely worth it for the amount of food and the quality of the food. The place is toddler friendly and they don't complain or make faces if something is accidentally dropped. They have coupons and are really nice

I've never associated good Chinese food with snappy decor, so the typical kitschy accoutrements actually made me smile rather than otherwise. However, the nostalgia and good vibes ended there.  The scallops were dry, the chicken feet were tasty but a little too oily and had clearly sat in the dim sum steamer for too long. The pork spare ribs dim sum were alright.  All in all, I'd go again in a pinch, but not otherwise.

I'm on a quest to find a Chinese restaurant that's tasty enough to be a regular haunt. Reviews for Harbor Palace have never been great so it really wasn't on my radar. We only stopped in because I've driven by it hundreds of times and curiousity had finally gotten the better of me.   We had eggrolls, sweet & sour chicken and eggplant in garlic sauce. The eggplant was really good, the rest was fine. Service was lackadaisical, but I suspect the language barrier might have something to do with it.

Is so bad. The food on the menu sound great but totally different when they come out. The price is too high and no lunch special either. We used to eat here in the morning for dim sum. Decide to go for lunch and I don't think I'm coming back anytime soon.

If you need to get your fix of chinese food in vegas...this is the place to come!  The best part about it is that it is open past 3am!  The worse part was that our food took over 30 minutes to come!  I highly recommend getting the Singapore style vermicelli noodles.  Sooooooooooo gooood!

i hate this place. i will never go back.   the chinese female servers here are the rudest people on earth. me and my party of 5 went around 1pm on monday to have some dim sum.   just fyi, i am not chinese. they continued to YELL at me in chinese as i was asking them what was in their dim sum carts. why do they have such  big stick up their arses? so what if i don't want the tripe or chicken feet? damn it lady, all i want is some har gow and shu mai.  practically threw our plates on the tables as if they were ninja stars.   i swear... if the food was good, i would give it at least 2 or 3 stars. but you know what? the food ain't even that great. sub par dim sum, blandest combination fried rice, the only thing that was ok was the duck noodle soup.  just thinking about this place gets me riled up.

Horrific!!! . bad service, bad food. Couldnt wait to leave. Before choosing this place after a 4 hr drive into Vegas and hungry at 12:30, we said lets pick this place, can never go wrong with dimsum.... Was  friggin wrong!! sat over 15 min with just a table cloth. No one came to our table (not even the cart ladies) for chopsticks, water, plate...nothing! I had to get up to ask. the cart ladies kept not going our way for over 10 min (even after we recd utensils. The floor planning is horrible. People were getting up with their tixs just to go get their own food. After 3 friggin horrific gross plates 45 min later (because thats all we could stomach) we left. 3 plates for $11.85. Are u kidding me!!?? Went to the bakery nx door,paid  $1.50 for my tasty heavenly bbq pork bun. Never again to this place!!

Dim sum is very salty and the selections were not fresh at all!  On top of the lousy food, they tried to charged me 2 extra items!  I always count how many we order.  The worst part of all is that the place is so dirty!!  I will never come again

Food was horrible.  My fried rice looked and  tasted like yesterday's dried out rice.  It was hard and crunchy.  Disgusting!  The war wonton soup was disappointing.  Soup had no flavor and the ingredients were soft and bland.  The only thing I enjoyed was the diet Coke that came in an unopened can.  Over $70 for lunch for 3.  Never again!

This place used to be hoppin' and THE PLACE to go for great Dim Sum in Las Vegas. You can tell as the place is always jammed packed with customers. There might even be a slight wait for a table. That's how good it was.   It's been a few years since I've been back, and I forgot why I stopped coming. Well, my last visit confirms it. Dim Sum not as tasty as it was. Doesn't seem fresh either. The fried noodles were dry and seemed like they were sitting on the cart for some time. I didn't bother to order the Gai Lan (Chinese broccoli) as it looked over cooked and cold. The place is out dated, old and dirty. There's even a smell of body odor throughout the place. I think it's stuck in the old carpet.   I'm sorry for the harsh comments. But I wanted to be completely honest and not have other customers be disappointed like I was. Go anywhere else but here if your looking for Dim Sum and a pleasant dining atmosphere.

I told myself, I'd try not to give 2 stars to restaurants, BUT eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeks this place was HORRIBLE.  I started off giving this place 2 stars, but after thinking about what I was going to write, i've downgraded it to a 1 star.  FOOD: each dish tasted OLD. The dim sum tasted like it was a day old and were just reheated to serve.  service: contrary to other reviews, the servers were actually friendly ambiance: diiiiiiiiiirty south, including the bathroom. yuck.  How the heck can you go wrong with dim sum? I should've yelped this place before deciding to meet up with some buddies.  5 girls= all gave 2 thumbs down each.

My friends and I were in Vegas this past weekend and were craving some dim sum. We weren't expecting much, but we were pleasantly surprised by the food and price!   We had orders of shu mai, shrimp noodle, chicken feet (only for one person), the free egg rolls with check-in, and more, and left stuffed! In total, our bill came out to be around $10 per person.   The service was good; everyone who greeted us was friendly and attentive. The reason this is getting four stars is because of comparisons back home in OC in Southern California. Still, I would definitely come back when in the area.

A regular late nite/early morning stop for gf and i  but we finally hit the place for dim sum this last sunday.  This might be our new "go-to" dim sum spot - Orchids used to be our place ( prior to that chang's ) but given their shutdown ( i assume a temporary thing ) for health violations, we need to find a few spots ( we still like PPP )   GF and I agree that the dim sum was consistently served hot and fresh.  The standard dim sum fare ( served on carts ) but the gf thought the selection was limited and nothing unique ( i agree on the uniqueness but i was ok with the selection )   the price is also a little higher than the other places ( $39 bill for the 2 of us - that's the most we've paid for a dim sum meal ) but i was so appreciated of the food being well prepared, hot and fresh.

We ended up here because we had a restaurant.com gift card for $15 off of $30. We got the dinner combination A. The food was pretty good but nothing to write home about. We had a ton of leftovers which is always a good thing. I would only go back to try the dim sum.

We were worried about coming here due to the poor yelp reviews. However ,we were really yearning for dim sum. We decided to come in and try this place. The Siomai, congee, sesame balls, chinese brocolli, shrimp dim sum, tripe dish and spare ribs were actually good. Service was also efficient and friendly. Prices were also good. Glad we were not disappointed.

Late night in Chinatown this is one of the few places that are still open at 1:00 in the morning. Despite the dirty/sticky menu, the food actually quite nice. Beef chow fun was tender and flavorful, and the mushu pork was well cooked. The bread tortilla was dry though, and made it tougher to roll up.   Staff friendly Parking easy Free egg rolls!

I wish I could give this place 0 stars...but the lowest I can give is 1. ANYWAY, service is ridiculously AWFUL in this place. I don't know if they have something against Filipinos, but three groups of Filipinos have walked out since we sat here.  Yes, I am here at the restaurant writing this review.  Why?  Because we have been waiting for our dimsum for 20 minutes now.  I am doing this review to kill time.  When we got here, we were never handed the menu.  BUT, the other two groups who came in after us, were handed their menus AND GIVEN SUPER VIP TREATMENT.  They gave their drinks right away and their menus.  When we flagged down the person (with glasses) at the front reception area who sat us down (since no one was around to help us) to ask for menus, he dropped the menus on our table as if we were a big inconvenience to him.  Same for when he dropped off the food we ordered...he dropped it on our table like he was forced to work today or not getting paid to work here. Also, while writing this, three groups of Filipino have walked out of the restaurant because of their service.  SO, if you are craving for Chinese food...DO NOT COME HERE!!!  Service is terrible!!!!  Avoid this place!!! Go somewhere else where it is worth to pay your hard earned money for food and service.

My dad and I just ate lunch there and it was a horrible experience. My bean curd dim sum had a screw in the sauce! I wish I had taken a picture of it. They exchanged it for a new one so we carried on with our lunch. But then, my dad bit into his sesame ball..... and his cap (tooth) came out! He bit onto something very hard, possibly a bone, something that should not have been in there. It took forever to get the manager to come to the table. She then said it was not a real tooth so it wasn't their fault and that my dad needs to be more carful when eating sticky foods. No apologies. No attempt to resolve anything. Very rude and argumentative. After much resistance she comped our meal. Unacceptable customer service! Poor food.

The worst dim sum place! The food tasted old like it was from previous day. Service was horrible. We asked for water refilled 3 times still no one came back with water even though there was only 2 tables in there. The best thing they had was fresh orange they gave at the end. We will never go back there again...
Charged us $96 for a catfish after quoting price as $30 (still too much for the small gnarly fish we got).  All I could do was laugh and wish I had eaten on the strip.

Ran through the Plaza to go to Ranch 99.  They were all out of the steamed sweet white rice cakes but had other things I needed.  On the way back to the car I passed by Harbor Palace and saw the painted 'dim sum' sign on their window.  All dim sum places have rice cakes, right?  It appeared very busy when I walked in but an older Chinese man came to the podium to ask for my order.  I asked him if they had the cakes, he walked over to a nearby cart and held up the asked for cakes.  I nodded and said I would like two orders.  He went to a little side table to box them and came back with them in a bag.  He said the charge was $5. Which I paid in cash. At home I opened the styrofoam container to find two 5x5 inch squares about 1/2 inch thick.  That was 2 orders for $5!  They were just okay, taste wise... If this is an indicator of their food, my recommendation is to pass.

The servers were all nice and friendly. We ordered 1/2 roast duck it was delicious and the serving was generous, the garlic eggplant and black bean chowfun were also tasty.  The hot and sour soup was a little different , more hearty ,than I'm used to but it was really good too . The sweetsour spareribs and lemon chicken were not good. Lots of parking.  Will be back again!

Decided to try something new so I got out of my comfort zone and tried this place out. I'm not a picky eater so I just went with whatever was brought to the table. The food was very good and made fresh. I enjoyed all the plates that were served Including the chicken feet. The only thing this place is lacking is a smile amongst the servers. They're a little pushing on making you say yes to plates so stand your ground and just say no if you don't want the plate. I would come back if I felt a little more welcomed too. I give this place another try in the future. Till then.
After moving out of LA I though I was never going to have good Chinese food; but, I was so wrong....this place is just like Chinatown in LA...well worth it! Thanks chinos locos...

This place was good! The food is relatively good and the prices are pretty average also. Not too expensive not too cheap. The food is tasty and fast- the dishes arriving at your table in a steady past. The servers are nice and helpful as well. Overall had a good meal.

Dim sum is good hot and fresh go in the morning less crowd rather than lunch hour but they can make dim sum at odd hours just request it.  This place makes great beef stew hot pot and half roast duck serving is plentiful and yu may have to take left overs home. Recommend to friends and family. Yummy!

Bless our server, she was doing her best. But the management and restaurant have no idea what's going on. Everything is dirty. We ordered 8 dishes and only 7 came out. The server kept asking the kitchen for it, we could hear the yelling, but it didn't come until the very end of our meal. When I tried to complain to the manager about having the late dish taken off my bill she tried to pin it on the server. It was not the servers fault. The restaurant is unorganized. Food is decent but not worth the extravaganza

I've lived and been to many major cities to know what good food is. And I've never gave a review before but I had to for this one. This place needs to be shut down! Everything about it from customer service to quality of food is unsatisfactory. Place looks dirty too! If a place serves daily dim sum it better at least taste fresh, but it wasn't. I came to try it out only because a friend referred it. We came in a large group of almost 20. We waited a Long time for dim sum cart to come around. Had to go ask them to bring cart around. I feel the the waitress played dumb by asking several times what we need to order. Told her 1 chicken shark fin soup and 1 lobster dish.  She comes out with 2 lobster dish and 2 soup!!!! Wth?! Soup was $49 for a bowl that serves 5 small cup. The soup tasted so plain! We didn't order it but got it anyways. We also ordered clams which never came out. And ate dim sum. When the ticket came out it was ridiculous amount for place like that! Almost $500! Overall the food quality doesn't match prices on menu. Over priced!!!They charged $8 for 1 bowl of steam rice! They charged us for  60 dim sum dishes too. The numbers looked really off!  I would say 40 but not 60! I went to check on price with cashier and came back to count empty dim sum plates but they had cleared off everything on table! Not to mention the waitress followed me to spy on me when i went to talk to cashier. Must be a reason for that! They are scammers! I've heard of dim sum places that over charge u but I've never experienced it. I'm never ever coming here again! I highly suggest not to come to this place.

The WORST dim sum & HORRIBLE service ever! Food was bland. Place is dirty. Don't bother coming if u dont speak chinese. All the carts purposely skipped our table. We waited forever & always got the last picks when it was cold & not fresh. Everything SUCKED!!!

Service sucked; asked for water 3 times personally and a few times by others at my table, and it didn't come until after we asked over 5 times. Same thing for additional sauces. Huge language barrier in this restaurant; bring someone who can speak and understand Chinese for adequate service.

This place is horrible with customer service and their staff is wearing this weird mouth guard wth.... Got me wondering what is wrong with this place!!!! Food is old, stale, and you have to chase your food down cause they attack us with one cart of dim sum and then that was it. All I can say is horrible horrible horrible service. Never coming back

After a big night out, went out here at 4AM to grab a quick bite before heading home!  Service was fast! Like "You-Just-Ordered-10-MINS-ago" fast but sh*t... FOOD WAS SERVED COLD!!!! and i meant, NOT EVEN WARM or ROOM TEMPERATURE at least?  The two quickest food you think they can prepare in a hurry, egg drop soup and chow mein, was probably a left over from the night before and didn't even bother to heat it up for us!   YUCK!!!!  Do yourself a favor!!!  Go somewhere else or just buy yourself a bowl of noodles from 7-11. Don't even think about going here!!   LOVE LIVE THE "PANDA". LOL

Basic dim sum in a strip mall. Food is fine. Service is what you should expect in a place like this -- few basic dim sum places are going to get lots of service points -- but it works. The food isn't something you are going to write home about , but it is fine.   The place was not very busy when we went on a Saturday a little before noon.   Note: If you take cab there have them call you one when you are ready to leave, we had a lot of trouble finding one.

Yuck Yuck about 2 years ago this was a Decent joint for authentic Chinese What Happend??? I am in Vegas and my family chose to return What a Mistake and where do I start First of all the place was filthy the rest room faucets were broken only hit water worked the tea was served with Luke warm water we ordered four dishes came out to $70 the service stunk my two boys wanted a smoothie for desert so I ordered two after I paid for the bill we waited 25 additional minutes as they forgot and were under staffed other people were upset at the bad service Chinese and tourists And the food was ok at best I will never go back there again and it was so bad it felt like the place had been taken Over due to a gamblers debt and the new owners have no idea when it comes to running a restaurant Funny thing I asked  My wife if she wanted to walk out when we first got seated but we stuck it out as We were starving kid thing but I should have trusted my instinct and visited the restroom before I ordered This place stunk and if they don't clean up there act I have a feeling they won't be in business very long

This is one of the first Chinese joint to opened up Chinatown, and I really cannot stretch how distinguish this place is.  It is one of those place you cannot avoid seeing driving down from the Strip.  The dcor was quite run down and dirty.  They served dim sum and other Chinese dishes.  Dim sum looked ok on average, while some of them looked somebody like vomited on it.  The taste was mind blowing in a negative way.  Some of them tasted like cardboard, while some just tasted bitter, and choices seem very limited.  The regular dishes had a unique bland flavor and gooey look to it, which was not appetizing at all.  Service was terrible here!  We called out for to the staffs a few times with no response and finally had to make some loud noise to get their attention, which really reminded me of mainland China.  Harbor Palace Seafood... Thank you for giving our group diarrhea on the way back to Utah, something was definitely undercooked.  On another hand, I found my worst Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas.  I never knew such taste can exist in dim sum, even worse than the worst in my home state.  Maybe that is one reason to try this place?

Have not been here in years AND WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!!, After reading the other reviews it seems as though nothing has changed.  I still remember the visit here vividly as it was the worst experience i have ever had at any restaurant in my entire life! I remember how dirty the place felt with the tacky decor, should have been a sign to run. Second issue the host had attitude to seat us in a booth with two children said no children allowed in booth. Didn't wanna hassle finding another place though because kids were hungry. We ordered walnut shrimp, Mongolian beef, salt n pepper pork chop and fried rice. About thirty minutes later I ask a guy where our food was. He said what food!? So I say never mind we are leaving. The original lady who took our order saw we were trying to leave started shouting "why u leave no pay, food coming u need to wait" [sic] 5 min later they proceeded to bring out food, they brought out fried shrimp, soup and Chinese broccoli. I said we didn't order this. She argued yes you did. By now I'm so livid I didn't wanna make a scene so I asked my husband to deal with them before I explode. So I go to the car. 20 minutes later he is walking to the car with the food we didn't order and I guess our order then I see the lady chasing him and saying no tip for me not even one dollar!! OMG are you serious?????!!!!!! She had the audacity to literary follow him outside and say this in the parking lot! Of course no tip, not after the absolute worst service ever !! That I thought was the worst part. My husband gets in the car to tell me the check was $83 meaning they charged us for the food we did not order!!!!!!!!!!!! He said the host who takes the checks wouldn't budge and said how does he know its not our fault and we keeping the food anyways even though we said we didn't want it he said ok we still made food if u keep or throw away u still have to pay! Unbelievable!!! If you want to experience a nightmare go here! Not saying your experience will be as horrendous as mine , but just thought I'd share my dining out nightmare here as I can see I'm not alone In this.  Yelp should have a "worst restaurant poll" guarantee this will come up! Shut harbor palace down!!!

For some reason I think of buffets and steakhouses when in Vegas but hey it's always good to try something different, so this is my first Chinese restaurant in LV.  Service was okay, dim sum food was average, prices were cheaper than Mei Sum back home.
Pretty good dim sum but not much variety going around.  Overall, just ok.

This place opens late. We came here for a really late dinner and we ordered:  Beef Chow Fun: This was ok. It came out hot and they gave a good amount. There was a good balance of beef and noodle.  Thousand Year Old Egg Congee: Eh, this was ok. It was slightly watery. This wasn't the best.  Chinese Donut: This was made fresh. It was really crispy and warm. I liked it.  Won Ton Soup: This wasn't that good. The soup broth tasted more like a chicken broth. The won tons were a bit large too.  Service was good. I think it was because we were the only ones here since it was late.   The restaurant is large. They have a lot of tables and enough space for larger groups.  Overall, ok place to eat at if there's no other place open.
Uhhhhhhhhhhhh horrible service!!!! And food takes FOREVER! Literally waited an hour for the food..... If you're seated in the back room, be ready to not get your food. Trust me.

Food's taste are very delicious, no doubt. A short haired & average tall woman seems to be the owner gives awesome customer service alongside with young waiter. But that day was our unlucky day, my girl ordered a yang chow fried rice and seemed they put extra shrimps on it. Despite curious, we did not think negatively.  On night, she began showing alergy symptoms : itchy, rashes, red and swolen skin. We know very well that she has no alergy to any seafood. It resisted for more than a week, thanks to her pediatrician to slowly make her recover. Yeah, there is always a lesson to be learned.

The servers were nice, unfortunately the food was not very good. I tried four different dim sum items. Three were way too salty for my taste. After paying our bill of $17 (plus tip) for two for lunch, we went to the bakery next door to buy a few more items for lunch.

Review regarding Dim Sum: I used to come here a lot, and it used to be good. When I heard they had dim sum, I was so happy. When they brought the first tray, I wanted to leave. They have a very small selection, and it made me want to cry.

I stopped at Harbor Palace for a late breakfast (AFTER shopping at 99 Ranch Market:--note to self--eat BEFORE shopping for groceries...) right when they opened at 10 AM.  I was extremely hungry, and extremely happy with what I got.  I was too hungry to wait and see what all the carts had on them, so I went with char siu bow (bbq pork buns) and the sticky rice dumplings wrapped in leaves.  Then, call me a fool,  I simply had to have the gai lan  (ChineseBroccolli) with "Korean Sauce" poured over it.  'Bout the only asian foods I love more than gai lan are fresh lychees and Peking Duck  The gai lan was just as good this evening as leftovers, reheated with a little bit of deep-fried tofu.  I thought the service was decent, not unctuous, not friendly, but decent.  The decor was a bit battered, but I've yet to eat in a Chinese restaurant that has both beautiful decor and great Chinese food.  I'll try to go back once a month and eat my way through all the different things they have to offer on their dim sum carts.  That is, AFTER I try the Chinese BBQ place in the same center and Ping Pang Pong at the Gold Coast this Thursday...
We came here as a group and the amount of dish for nine people was too little. All the dish were not fresh and way too salty. Need a lot of improvement.

Bad & Slow service.   Saturday at 11:00am 7.3.15. Got a table for 3 in 5 minutes.  Got our drinks right away then the first dim sum food cart came about 5 minutes later. 15 more minutes and no food cart in sight.  We got up & paid for our so called dim sum bill which was 15usd & ZERO tip.  We headed over to the Jade which was formerly Cathay House.  Got all kinds of dim sum food in 5 minutes or less.  Speedy service and food was great also... NEVER AGAIN, HARBOR PALACE..... SMALL and Bad Service.... Save yourself the time from waiting and head over to the Jade which is about 1 miles East of Harbor Palace on Spring Mountain
first time here, very good food, place seems clean, food is really tasty, prices are reasonable and staff are friendly, love the late hours

Had a reservation, they didn't have our table ready for 30 min. Pathetically incompetent servers that do not care about giving good service. Waited 40+ minutes for one entree to come out while tables around get all of their good serves before us even though we ordered first.   Also disgustingly unclean utensils that had brown stains on them.   I will be making a report to a local health inspector to make sure this health hazard of a restaurant shuts down.   Avoid at all costs for your own safety

Been here several times. Food isn't great but it's usually a convenient location and we're not familiar with other dim sum places in the area. We typically order: ha gao (shrimp ball), siew mai (pork ball), loh mai gai (sticky rice and chicken wrapped in leaves), churng fun (rice noodles with beef or shrimp, your choice), and some various buns (nai wong bao - small white buns with yellow custard inside).   They are stingy with the utensils, napkins and soy sauce. If you order to-go and don't ask, they won't give them to you. If you ask, they will only give you one even if you order many items.
Waitress so stupid and bad service. I ask for coke one of them told me don't have and rush me to order and told me"hurry hurry me busy". Don't go this place.!!!!

Food was great !!! Service is extremely poor!! I granted a dollar tip! Due to a huge language barrier orders were lost in translation. Even if you ask with a charming smile accompanied with a polite please the waitress greeted you with furiously rolling eyes and a disgruntled grunt! Seriously where is my water?!!! I am parched!!  Tip for tat: if you work in the food service industry, Do not count your money in front of your customers with a smile then serve your customers with an ugly frown and poor service!!!

My Wife and I were brought here with friends while in Vegas and we really liked it.  I don't understand the reviews but hey it is what it is. All of the food tasted fresh,  plus get this, my service was good.  Now, I can understand why people think the staff is rude, but they were nice enough for my group.  I totally will go back to this place next time I'm in town.

My parentals wanted to go over here because they heard that it was really good. What they found out was that it was really over priced.  The decor is decent and there were a lot of tables but a lot of them were empty too.  Yeah, the food is decent as well and some items are tasty but some of it was sub-par and tasted like you can get it anywhere else for a lot cheaper. I was not a fan of their dim sum chicken feet which was sad because it was China Town and I would prefer one of the dim sum places here in Utah instead. We got some fried rice, fried fish and an oyster stir fry and they were good but way to pricy for what it was worth.  In the land of Las Vegas, you can absolutely find a better place than this without looking too hard. So, I'd pass this restaurant and find a better deal elsewhere.

What can you ask for as a Chinese in Las Vegas........ to have a dim sum place around the Sin City China town..  However, the fact that I am from the San Francisco Bay Area..... makes this restaurant a really so so so so place........   No offensive...but remember, You are in Vegas...not Macau..... so, having more authentic Chinese food around is already a good thing

My family and I love Dim Sum!  The Harbor palace serves great Dim Sum. We were seated quickly.  Our drink orders were taken    Promptly.  The carts were full and came around often.  The service was great.  My kids loved the fried crab claws!  We all loved the delicious dim sum and the salt and pepper shrimp.
Food is good but the place is kinda dirty. Make sure to use a straw and not drink straight from glass. Lipstick on rim and food stuck inside glass. Yuk!
This was the worse Chinese food I've ever had and their restrooms are disgusting. It's so dirty and they reuse the complimentary fruits they give you towards the end

We come to LV a couple of times a year and ALWAYS come to this restaurant.  The last two times have been awful.  Service is OK, but you need to be assertive to get attention.  Food is quick and hot, but bordering on tasteless.  I can make a much tastier noodle plate that they serve, and I am not a cook by any stretch of the imagination.  We've been so disappointed.  In fact, I'm on Yelp now trying to find a new Chinese Rest to go to.

Came here for dinner after Black Friday shopping. Great selection of seafood: fish, squid, crab, lobster, Oyster, geoduck, and shark fin. Didn't ask whether or not the shark fin was sustainable or not...   Hot and sour soup was good, as well as the sizzling black pepper beef. Chinese broccoli was cooked very well. Very tender but not too soft.  I gave two stars because I found the prices to be high and the service was intermittent. They were very attentive in the beginning and gave great recommendations (sizzling beef and hot and sour soup) but then were nonexistent when e tried to get more hot water for our tea.

This place is dingy though clean. It's painted in a lackluster pastel light blue on the inside. No frills at all here. They serve dim sum the traditional way by having ladies come around with carts. The quality of the food did not convince me. We were also pretty sad that the Chinese Broccoli was not ready yet.... We love our Chinese Broccoli....seriously love it too! They have a very homestyle flavor to their food here. Not that I know what homestyle Chinese food tastes like so much as the food has a really basic flavor to it here. It doesn't really stand out. Some of the dumplings reminded me of Mexican style chicken soup flavor. Not that that is bad really, but still I am used to better tasting dim sum. Service is not bad. They kept on asking if we wanted tea refills which s really good for this kind of place - especially when it's busy. If you do not wish to understand that some people that work and serve food in this country don't speak English terribly well you won't like it here at all and of course - you will mistake it for bad service. Parking is a breeze. This restaurant is in a nice big lot where many of the buildings have pretty Chinese style roofs.

Discovered by my little sister she suggests I go here, we all meet up around 3pm for a late lunch and the place is pretty empty so we get prompt service. The place was a little dirty, burned holes in the plastic (smoking in vegas? ;) ) but let me tell you about the food.   We ordered two fish dishes and a chicken dish along with dim sum. The serving sizes were nicely portioned we had tons leftover. And those who never eat fish were eating the food here and asking for me.  Want to know what I ate? we had to call it all chicken for my little niece to eat any of it, so the dishes were scallop chicken, white chicken, and just to tease her mind we called the chicken dish -- fish. And wow was she proud to tell her mom she liked fish :)

Harbor Palace serves up average dim sum with a few above average items. The har gow was above average, while the 1K year old egg and pork porridge was bland and tasteless. Other items including the char siu bao and spareribs in black bean were acceptable and average.  The decor was a bit of fusion between Southern China and Vietnamese dive. Plenty of neon signs all plugged into few outlets which left me eyeing the emergency exits in case of electrical fire. I spied a couple of them moving waterfall art on one wall, which amused me with its tackiness and plebian charm.  Prices for the dinner menu are on the high side, but that seems par for the course for LV chinese food. You won't find those family meal deals available at 99% of the California chinese dives.  Service is standard dim sum which means little to no attention. No surprises here. At least you can tip 10% without any guilt whatsoever.  I have a feeling this place is the only game in town for acceptable dim sum, smack dab in the middle of Chinatown. Please prove me wrong!

Sam woo was closed so we had no choice but to eat here and we got it to go and took it back to our Hotel room. We found and effin worm in our Kang Kong veggies!!! and then to top it off an hour after I was throwing up all night! Disgusting! Do Not Go here!

Decent food, but chaotic service and a very stressful dining experience.   As another yelper mentioned , it is probably a waste of time writing a review for this place since folks with simply continue dining at this location regardless of the substandard service and the chaotic atmosphere.

Writing a review for this place is kind of a waste because it's probably one of the few places to dim sum in Vegas, therefore, they'll still have people coming in.  Let's start off with how the hostess skipped our number. Our number is 83. She called 82 and suddenly jumped to 87 and 85 went to complain. So she gave 85 and 87 a table and then when we asked she claims she already called us.... so because of her mistake, she stuck us at a table in the back- a table that I don't think was meant to be a table... why do I say that? The table was not set and was never set. Server just put plates down and didn't even put a white cloth over it. I was the only awkward wooden, wobbly table... with no sauce ... I went ahead and took the sauce from table beside me... okay .. whatever. Server bought us our tea and was never seen again... except to serve the tables besides us. CART ladies... simply looks at us and turns around... they would serve the tables next to us and stop beside them.. look over at us and turns around. LOL! WUT??? We only had two dishes and it got so ridiculous I chased after them TWICE. Both times, I let them know we need food, you guys don't even come to us. One lady had the nerve to ask "where are you sitting?" I saw you look at our table and turned your cart around and bounced..... Service was non existent. Like wtf. Couldn't even find a server to pay our bill. I would have LOVED to walk out and not pay. Carts rarely came around. Like are ya still serving dim sum or na? Food was average.  2 stars for such shitty seating arrangement and service! I barely even got to taste the food since no one came around and I was tired of running after them.

Ahhhhh, I was so pissed after I got outta that place. In one point of my life, I was totally fascinated with dim sum and for my 21st b-day, we decided to go to vegas (so typical). I am proud to say that I was sober the whole weekend. Anyways, we went there only a Sat. morning and it was pretty packed. We had to wait for about 30 mins. First off, the dim sum here is expensive. I think that's the only thing I remember besides leaving the place and regretting I went there! haha
Was told by local friends this place is a tourist trap. Well, there was no wait on a weekend, the food was solid, the price was reasonable. All good!

Took my wife and daughter in for lunch. before we were sitting in our chairs we were bombbarded by 3 or 4 hot carts of various delights(not really my thing) One menu for the 3 of us we ordered sodas they came in cans with glass of ice (I used to get that when I was in PI) Wife and Daughter ordered #4 chicken chow mein I ordered #7 the beef chop suey.  one cart can by with pot stickers they were the highlight of the meal  then another one said to try the fried noodles tasted like they used burnt oil to fry them inedible, then the lunch came not worth 1/2 star for taste or presentation. Sorry I know times are hard but this was not worth the $34 it cost us for a budget lunch.       Now for the service, waitress was impatient with us one menu for 3 people wouldn't' try to answer our questions, Was rude to my wife.  I am going to learn to cook chinese food for myself.

Purpose of visit: late lunch after spending the morning shooting each other during paintball. Group decided to go for a lighter meal given the time. Service is quick and efficient. Food is above average Chinese. Some of the dishes we ordered was fried pork chop. Pieces we battered and fried but a little small. Steamed whole sea bass. Garlic and spring onions made this dish very fresh. Fried rice and noodles were typically reliable.  Space is large and old accommodate a group of 12 very easily late afternoon.

My family always comes here whenever we're in Vegas, but more out of convenience and habit really.  The food here is ok and I would have given the place 3 stars, but it's just soooo dirty here.  I had to take off one star because the bathrooms are horrendous here ... so much so that there were 4 stalls and i almost died going in there ... I couldn't go needless to say and decided to hold it in!
I Would never order from here again. Found pieces of metal and bones in our sweet and sour. I can only imagine what other type of unseen things were in that food. Gross

My review is based on the service here. They are awfully rude. I've visited a few times and it's the same every time. I've always ignored it cause the dim sum is decent and at the time, it was the only place I knew in china town to have dim sum. Plus, in general, I always get bad service at Chinese joints. The worst was when we came in a large group. They were so disrespectful throwing our food down, and not responding when we would request something. Our group just sat there in silence at the end of our meal. We started discussing how much to tip. A person in our group who was a residence of Vegas said not too, and said something about how, in Vegas, we don't tip. He was a fairly rude guy himself lol but the worker came behind him, bent over and demandingly yelled in his ear "15% tip please". Oh man, he was furious. He stood up and yelled at us and his girlfriend to leave while she was still eating her tofu dessert lol it's pretty funny to think back but at the time, it was the worst experience ever.   Seriously, go to Orchid garden for dim sum.

Good place to get your dim sum fix off the strip. 8 of the 10 items I ordered were very good, the other two were mediocre. See pics n caption.  Xiu Mai, har gow n chicken feet were good, the very basics of dim sum. Check in and get free egg rolls (hardly worth it, they're lame fillers).... Anyway our total check came to around $40.  Other things I saw: small fried fish, chicken wings, seaweed, soft tofu, stewed beef intestines, diff types of fried shrimp balls, deep fried shrimp with head, authentic plain greasy chow mein, steamed Chinese broccoli, bean curd, steamed buns (sweet or with meat filling)... Etc.  Btw, seemed only the owner spoke good English, everyone else.... You can't get too intricate with them. Service was efficient but, some of the dim sum cart ladies need to learn some manners. So owner, pep talk your peeps.

We drove across town to eat some late night Chinese food, to find they closed 30mins early. All because they felt like it, the employees where sitting at tables with their phones out. So unprofessional I will never go back and I am a regular.

When I first moved to LV, the new friends I made took me out to eat here.  I thought, chinese? Why not!  But when I saw the servers rolling carts around I was wondering what kinda restaurant this is.  THEY SERVE DIM SUM! It was my first time ever having dim sum and I had a good experience here.  I noticed the servers would mad dog you if you didnt want anything from their cart.  I found that funny.  They serve all the dishes a chinese restaurant would serve but they're honey walnut prawns are especially good.  Although theres other places I would go first for Dim Sum, Harbor Palace is a good alternative. But then again, its in China Town, and other dim sum spots are close-by. =/
The service was aweful. Staff seemed to be pissed off at life. The food was not that great.

Try this place every time I am in Las Vegas. It is a hit or miss with the food but I feel the  price is reasonable.  We got seated real fast despite Mother Day. The guy asked us what we wanted to drink I requested for durian shake since they have it on the menu but he told me they don't have, he try to get me order Thai tea, I then try to order the mix fruit tea jar, he then proceeded to get another lady over who then told me that isn't a cold tea but it is a hot tea then proceeded to point to the Thai tea again . In the end I settle with hot tea & ice water. We ordered bitter Mellon with pork rib, super seafood with tofu soup, fried tofu with seafood and sizzling beef hot plate. it was decent but I wouldn't get the fried tofu with seafood again since it tasted bland and got too many broccoli in the dishes as well. There were hardly any seafood in the dish and what I thought was small small to non existing size scallops tastes like fish paste. I didn't find any shrimp in that dishes either and for a moment I thought this is a vegetarian dish.  As for the soup there were lots and lots of tofus, carrots and maybe there are couple of cut up shrimp in the soup basically this could be another vegetarian dish. Overall if you are a meat eater, skip those two dishes but if you are vegetarian, those dishes would be great. The dinner cost about 55$ total for the two of us with some left over food to take home .   For those reviews who complain about the dated decors and run down place, I agreed but I am not there for the place , I am mainly there for the food so the surrounding shabby decors doesn't bother me and beside it is Asian restaurant so I don't expected much

What you want? The Fu King Rice. You want Fu King Rice? Yes. Anything else? No, just give me the Fu King Rice.  The entrees are actually not bad if you wanted some Chinese grub.  But not really worth coming off the strip just for.  It's OK.  Avoid the dim sum as it is usually not fresh and overpriced, i.e. the steamed stuff have been sitting around long enough for like siu mai/har gow wrappers to start to harden.  Aiyah!  As usual service helps a bit when you can speak Cantonese at these places.  All in all, average.

I'm going to rate this five stars, because they serve dimsum all day every day. For anyone who works in the evening shift or for any one who is simply  craving for dimsum, this is the place to be.  Don't expect to get a fast service or quality of service. This place is always jam-packed, tourist buses usually stops over in this place for their lunch or dinner itinerary.
Decent dim sum and a crazy screaming host to boot.

The food is always great and super yummy except for the fried chicken which gets really hard. The place kinda looks a little dirty too ( I guess which is something normal for any chinese restaurant). The staff mostly are chinese which i dont know if I mistake them for being rude or just a communication problem. Otherwise, food is awesome!

This is a Dim Sum restaurant in the heart of Las Vegas' China Town. I was quite disappointed with their food. I thought their food selection was very limited and did not seem fresh. The noodles we ordered were dry and lacked taste. The rice congee with mushroom and century egg was okay and was the best part of our lunch. The only positive thing I can say about this place is that the waitress and servers are very nice and friendly. But I'm sorry to say that I would not go back to this restaurant when in Vegas since there are too many other options out there.
My friend did not like his beef dish, and the cut was low quality. I ordered steamed vegeys off the menu- they charged $25 for that. Are they for real? Not planning a return trip.

Nothing says "I'm thankful for American independence" like 1AM dim sum on the 4th of July! This place is regularly open til 5AM, which further begs the question: how I have I not been here before?!  Late night dim sum menu is about 15 items, we sampled quite a few. Steamed pork buns were solid, pork shumai were tasty, shrimp balls were fresh, beef tripe was not my bag, and the noodle in the spare rib rolled noodle dish had an odd flowery aftertaste.   Overall, flavors were solid and pricing was fair. Service was nonexistent despite 4 employees walking around. Orchid Garden is my usual go-to spot for gut-busting amounts of dim sum, and it sort of works in Harbor Palace's favor that they have a limited menu: I can come by more often without completely throwing my health goals out the window!
This place is OK, nothing special and if you come mid afternoon there is not much dim sum to choose from.  There are better places to get dim sum.

I do not know what other people talking about but this place is nice. Very good rost duck and dim sums. Very fresh and cooked to order and price is avarage ( actually rost duck is cheaper than other chinese restaurants in neighborhood) Open ntill 5 am and rice and tea is free. Highly recommended.

After a long night in Vegas, I was craving dim sum the next morning. I have been to Harbor Palace for dinner several times but it was my first time here for dim sum.   I have to say, the dim sum was not good! It was very disappointing. I ordered siu mai, har gow, chicken feet, shrimp rice roll, glutinous rice wrapped with lotus leaf, pork bun, and this vegetarian dish. The soy sauce for the shrimp rice roll was really watered down for some reason so the rice roll tasted really bland. The chicken feet was alright but it was a little too oily for me. The siu mai and shrimp dumpling was alright too. You can't go wrong with ordering that at a dim sum place! The vegetarian dish was a little weird. They used too much corn starch to thicken the sauce and you can tell because the sauce was chunky. It was very unappetizing.   The decor of this place is kind of runned down and old. It definitely needs some renovation, especially because it was one of the restaurants in the main plaza of Las Vegas Chinatown. They should make an effort to build a better image for themselves and for the town.   The place was also understaffed. There was one lady taking care of 3 carts! I felt bad for her that she had to take care of all these tables and also manage her carts.   The tea that we ordered was also not that good quality because after the second refill of hot water, the tea became really bland and lost the taste and aroma of the tea! Usually tea leaves can last through couple of refills.   I am still on the search for a good dim sum place in Vegas!

We went here around noon for dim sum.    One of the things that initially bothered us about this restaurant during the first few times we went was that they had a $10 minimum purchase amount to use credit cards.    Well today when we went, our bill was about $34 for the three of us.  We decided to just have them split it between two credit cards.  The waitress came back and told us "sorry, we have a $20 minimum purchase per card".  What????  The fact that they raised their minimum credit card purchase to $20 was annoying, compounded with the fact that the bill was over $20, and she didn't want to do it just because it would have been split between 2 cards.  I told her she had no choice but to take the cards because it's against VISA and Mastercard's rules to impose minimum purchase limits, and they could lose their ability to accept credit cards if we reported them.  She either took my card, or she didn't get paid at all. Simple as that.

Oh. My. Sweet. Jesus. What. In. Lord. Buddha's. Name. Is. This. Restaurant. Doing?  Where to even begin here? The food is piss poor, the restrooms looks like the one from that horror movie "Saw", and the service because of the language barrier is horrible. (I may be Asian, but I'm definitely not Chinese)  The waitress was nice and kind, but she didn't understand anything that we were saying.  The food smelled off and was unbelievably greasy, you have no idea. I wish I took photos, but I couldn't because I didn't want a picture of that disgusting pile of slop on my phone.
