Please heed my warning, do NOT eat here. DO NOT EAT HERE. Don't do it, it is a total waste of money. This place is terrible. I will give it a second chance only if it steps up its game better.
Wow such excellent service I've eaten at many restaurants in China Town and haven't been treated this well in any restaurant in china town to top it off the food was excellent.

DIM SUM review only.  We came here on a Wednesday during the lunch hour and had the dim sum.  This is by far the ABSOLUTE WORST DIM SUM I'VE EVER HAD.  Hands down, there is no competition.  The siu may tasted old and disgusting; the shrimp dumpling was slightly better, but not much to care for; the spare rib pork on top of rice noodle (huh?) was tasteless and so was the BBQ pork in rice noodle dish; congee also had no flavor; har gow was just lukewarm and tasted just ok.  The best thing we had was the egg custard pastry.  I won't come back here for dim sum ever.

Poor Las Vegas needs to UP their game on DIM SUM. As a San Francisco resident, I know some good Chinese food/ Dim sum. Harbor palace seems to be run down and caters more to.. people who don't know what good Chinese food is. They only had about 2-3 dim sum carts going around with not much of a variety to choose from. We got an order of chicken feet which were huge and tasted right, one shrimp and one beef cheung fun which was okay.. an order of spareribs which sucked... and one ha gao and sui mai which were decent, and an order of sesame balls and cha sui bao which I didn't try. We also ordered a plate of beef chow fun which was decent but very very greasy. Over all the dim sum wasn't fresh, but tasted decent, the prices are steep, and not worth it.
Had the rau muong with chao so delicious.  You must try the sea bass hot pot, it melts in your mouth.  The service is wonderful very attentive and nice.

the order. shu mai har gow bean curd wrap in gravy rice noodle with shrimp gyoza shanghai dumpling  the food here is edible but i think that's where my compliments stop. the dim sum here was not fresh and they use a lot of low quality pork meat--meaning very fatty parts of the pork. the balance of lean and fat was not struck with this dim sum. the rice flour for the har gow was too chewy and borderline hard (as if it was reheated). the shanghai dumpling was probably the worst thing i had. i personally would not return to this establishment but it is an alternative to much of the generic vegas food. not to mention, when i first started out eating dim sum this would have been acceptable to me as im sure it is acceptable to the new palettes of many tourists that probably frequent this place.

So bad! The worst Cantonese Dim sum place I have tried in my life. The food taste extremely bad and food are dirty. The rice roll seemed to be cooked several days ago, rigid and not soft at all. Disappointed
Place needs some work to be done. But overall I get excellent service here during the late hours after a night at the disco! Hasnt let me down yet!

I haven't ate dim sum for quite a while and I miss it so much. So when we headed to Vegas, we want to eat that. We found this place in Chinatown plaza. The dim sum wasn't so bad. It's a nice place. At least the service was good.

This used to be my go-to place for dim sum and seafood but it has really gone down hill over the years. I won't be returning, unfortunately. Just doesn't seem fresh, almost like reheated frozen dim sum. And the restaurant is run down.
Not my favorite dim sum, but still enjoyable.  Average service.  Bathrooms smelled like a mix of chlorine and bleach.

Dim Sum... anytime... Every visit. Every Time. Only place you can find the noodle rolls with pork ribs. The shrimp and beef noodle rolls are good too. the noodle is not too thick and cakey. Also has buy one get one free Lobster with noodles. Great deal. about $30 bucks. Tastes way better than Orchid Garden.

I was actually trying to eat at Ichiza in the early afternoon, which is in next building over, but I forgot to check that they actually opened up at 5pm.  Still being guided by my rumbling stomach, I looked at nearby restaurants in Las Vegas' "Chinatown".  While walking around, The Love us on Yelp Sticker on Harbor Palace's door caught my eye.  I thought to myself, "How awesome!!  Another loved yelp spot, the food here must be great!".  Oh how I was wrong.  Immediately, when I got in there, the atmosphere was dreary, somewhat old fashioned, and a little unkempt.  I then thought, " Well, maybe all the energy is poured into the excellent food and service, yelp will not let me down!  Again, I was completely wrong.  I started with the noodle dish and BBQed beef, and I ended with those.  I second that prior review, the noodles were both bland, dry, and greasy if you can believe that.  The BBQed beef was damn near all fat too.  I was like "What the hell?  I didn't remember ordering a big dish of just meat fat."  This place needs to be checked out by the restaurant sanitary inspector because it looks a little dirty.  My waitress even brought out a disgusting looking fish bucket to show the table right behind me.  What was that all about?  And to top it off, I waited nearly 20 minutes for the waitress to bring me back a doggy bag.  My bill was 20 or so dollars for some reallyyy crappy food.   I felt ripped off, let down, and regretful I even entered the door with the supposed "They love us on Yelp" sticker.  How did they get that sticker?  Did they steal that?  Well, I sure felt that they had just stolen my money.  Avoid this place if you can.

When we came in, we thought it was a decent place. When the food come in the staff with the dim sum cart were really rude. The food was overprice and some of the food are bland. The chicken feet was so salty. Totally do not reccomend to eat here.

This was my first time here. Came from a recommendation from a family member. First time having dim sum in Las Vegas. Steamed BBQ pork bao was great. BBQ pork in rice noodle really good. Staff was ok sort of friendly but wasn't expecting much. Might be better for dinner than lunch.  Probably more choices.
This place is horrible. The lady ran out asking my dad why he only tipped $5. They're pathetic.

Food off the menu is pricey and not worth it!   Dim Sum is horrible! Reheated in the microwave after a long rancid stay in the carts.   This place used to be good 10 years ago, but I am so over it! Blech!

We ordered off the menu instead of dim sum. The food was delicious and the service was good. They were attentive, but really tried to sell the dim sum despite us saying no multiple times but I attribute the persistence to cultural differences. I will return. The manager sat at a table and explained almost the entire menu for another party, thought that was pretty cool.  I recommend the rock cod filet with black bean sauce, the fish was like butter.

If I could give this place a zero star I would.  In conclusion  of you want to have decent Chinese food this is definitely not the place. Oh and don't even mention the service. It's the worst I have ever seen.   I have been here many times and each time I give them an excuse for their shitty service like oh they don't understand English, but today is my last straw.   Maybe because of people like me who keep giving them chances that why they are still able to open for business. Well. NEVER AGAIN.   People if you want chinese food. You better off spending your money else where. They are many places near by.   Good luck to whoever that wants to eat here.

Lackluster service with takeout quality food.   My girlfriend and I took her father here. We entered the restaurant and the host was on a personal phone call with her back to the door. We listened to her for a while, then she realized we were there and quickly hung up. We were sat at a table with a dirty table cloth under a pane of glass.   The president was in town and Channel 8 was showing the speech. I asked if they would show the speech on one of the three TVs which were all turned off. The manager said the TVs were reserved for advertising, and turned on one of the TVs to some type of advertising channel which did not show advertisements for the restaurant (think video games and movies.) The other two were not turned on.   The menu has approximately 200 entrees and took a while to read. The servers seemed impatient, and I do mean servers, as we had multiple servers.  We got our appetizer, and the server spilled the sauce on the table. She said, "Oops," but did not clean it. The entrees were not far behind, and the same server set the first dish in the sauce she had spilled.   The food was food, and I cannot say it wasn't. Her dad and I ordered a two person family dinner. It was greasy, bland, and surprisingly poor quality for $15 a person, but it was still food. My girlfriend's hot pot was bad. It was still food too, but she did not enjoy it. We ate until we were full, and then I used the bathroom.  Which brings me to the bathroom. The exterior door was filthy; the kind of filthy which causes you to dread entering the restroom. Think "behind the gas station in Kingman, AZ" dirty. Once in the men's restroom, you will find there are two urinals. The one on the left was leaking onto the floor, and the leak spread under the other urinal. This makes it impossible to use without standing in the leak. The leak runs even further under the stalls, and I imagine your pants would get wet if you had to sit on the toilet. The floor was sticky in the dry spots.   We shall never return.

We've eaten here several times for both the dim sum (lunch) and dinner. Yes the place is run down.  Extensive menu.  Reasonable prices, especially the dim sum, loved everything.  Had the house special fried rice and sizzling seafood plate last night mmmmm, even the sweetsour chicken I ordered for the kids was good.  Service seemed pretty attentive, we were the only wide-eyes in there :). Will definitely go back for the food/prices.
Horrible service and worst food ever!!!!!!! The lady there served a noncooked pork dim sum to us and yelled at us she knew nothing about it. If they allow 0 star in Yelp, I will definitely do this!!

I ordered through Eat 24 for delivery. They waited 35 minutes to inform Eat 24 that they don't have a delivery driver. By now it is too late to order delivery from any other Chinese restaurant. It's extremely unprofessional that it took so long to let them know they couldn't deliver. Will never try to order from this place again.

It's in China Town and was busier than any other place in the strip . We decide to try it .... the place overall is dirty , the carpet the tables etc . The food was mediocre but the staff was nice and attentive . Wouldn't come back but I'm accused of being a good snob !

Walked in on a Wednesday, and there wasn't a wait. I can see why. The carts took FOREVER to come around. The "servers" were MIA. Asked for a soda, and it took about 20 minutes to come. The food here is blehhh. The service is nonexistent.... The people rolling the carts, rolled right passed us and didn't even ask if we wanted anything! RIDICULOUS!!!! Probably will never come here again. Sticking to Cathay House!

The food was alright but some of the foods we ordered were cold and not fresh. Also the plates, chopsticks, and cups looked a little dirty. Later on during our lunch, some other people came into the restaurant and were seated to a table close to us, but they were arguing and the manager didn't do anything about it. Once we were done we paid our check and got our change back out of $40 and they still asked for a tip, which was was very rude. Tips are voluntary and shouldn't be asked for. I paid them a tip even though they didn't deserve it because I'm for sure not going back there again.

Craving dim sum while on our Vegas vaycay, we decided to try this place out. The food is mediocre, service was ehh, and just about the only good thing was the decent pricing. Maybe it's not a fair comparison, but after dining exclusively at Mayflower for all my dim sum needs (maybe it's a Bay thing), Harbor Palace was a let down. The food really tasted little better than the stuff you get from the frozen aisle of the Asian market.  It didn't seem like the cleanest place to eat either.... So skip this place and find another!

My first impression was how dirty and old the carpet was. I chose Harbor Palace because of convenience. The were able to take a reservation over the phone. But when I showed up, they were not that busy to begin with. So the reservation didn't really help much.  The food was decent, nothing to rave about. Service was ok, very typical for Chinese establishments. They did take a long time to return our CC back to us when we paid the bill, so who knows if it's been compromised. I guess we'll find out in a few weeks..

This was the worst dim sum ive ever had! Went there for lunch atound 1 pm there food wasnt warm because the lady asked us if we wanted it heated up. We should have just walked out then. There was a hair on the soy sauce container too. Lost our appetite after that. Grocery store dim sum would have been better.
Had dimsum here today, the usual siomai, hagao, spare ribs, chicken feet, sticky rice and veggie dimsum. All for $23.00 and we're very satisfied! Yum.

This place is fairly decent. The dim sum was alright and the service was ok, not very attentive. You are required to  spend a minimum $20 to charge your credit card. Smehhhh... Not impress. No wow factor here for me to come back.

The only gripe I have about this place is the slow service. But other than that, for dinner, the food is pretty good.  I enjoyed the egg flower soup and honey walnut shrimp.  The prices are not that expensive, comparative to the ones in Southern California.

What a shame how dirty this restaurant has become. I think a lot of yelpers are a little harsh on the food. It's fine. A little greasy, but it's OK. Doesn't deserve 1 star. I think the 1 star comes from poor service and how run down it is. The service is worse than a typical Chinese restaurant, but to me it's always been that way. My wife is Chinese and I'm used to the personality. However at seafood harbor it's worse. Seems to be accepted by management if not encouraged. It's a shame. A little clean up, and some lessons in customer service and they might see a real increase in sales

Came here for dim-sum and the food was good but thats about it. Service was not great, but this is not the type of restaurant that you expect that so it was fine. Really just gets the job done but if you yelp other places, you'll find great alternatives in Vegas as well.

Check your bank statements after paying with card! Went to dinner here and ordered too much.  We called for reinforcements.  Friends didn't show up so we asked to pack up the dinner and for the check.  After they packed everything up they brought out the fortune cookies but no check.  Our friends walk in and we decide to keep them company because they decided to order a few things.  So we share our to go's with them have a nice dinner.  Time for the check again they put it all on one.  Ok no problem let's get this fixed because I'm a receipt keeper. Ohhh they printed out a second receipt looks like from a calculator adding their 20% tip lol hey I don't mind you we're gonna get it anyway.  So now he's arguing with me about how he doesn't know how to do that I explain that I like to keep a record of my card transactions and we were paying with 2 different cards would we be able to each tip.  He said ya ya I'll charge both cards.  Ok whatever I jus want to leave because he's not going to do it I think he was more worried about making sure he gets that 20% tip.  For all that trouble and arguing with me we decided to do a 15% tip.  Well according to the bank statement they took another $10 wow I've never seen that before.  If that $10 was more important than having repeat business keep it.  The food was ok.  The place is dirty they were big dumplings droppings under our table.  The bathroom was disgusting.  I can say I tried it and I'll tell everyone on social media not to go there

I regularly visit Vegas throughout the year and decided to come in with my family because we were craving Chinese food. We weren't expecting much as it was our first time trying this place out. We were able to indulge in both dim sum and food that can be ordered from a menu. While the food was of average quality, the service was horrible. It took more than 5 people to take our order. It took 30 minutes to get water. And we were left staring at our soup because they served it without bowls for the table. I will not be back.
Best after hours spot to hit up, orange chicken and duck is amazing! We always take our friends here who visit Vegas. Price is affordable!

We are from out of town and My husband and I came here with another couple who likes to come here when they are in town and they said the food was pretty good for authentic Chinese food despite what I read on the reviews from other yelpers. So I checked in with yelp and a nice surprise showed saying we get 20% off our bill. The coupon said in small print from 10pm-2am, it was 9:54pm when we ordered. They had a special for lobster buy one get one free for $48.95 so we ordered the lobster special, seafood soup, snow pea tip and clams in oyster sauce. The soup came out nice and hot but lacked in flavor - it was very bland, the clams was nothing special- taste like any other Chinese restaurant, the snow pea tip was smothered in oil and soggy. The lobster was a disappointment as well, it was more like buy one lobster and get a half lobster free- there were missing pieces to our lobster- we definitely did not get another lobster for free and it was very tiny for the price. The best part was when we asked if we could use our 20% off coupon they said yes and then came back to us and said "sorry sir you ordered your food at 9:54pm and the coupon starts at 10pm." We politely said "ok no problem, we understand if that's your policy." But...really? Does it makes a difference for that 6 mins? It's all about customer service! Let's just say we will not be coming back.

Love this place. It's my favorite dim sum place in Las Vegas. All the food is always steaming hot and fresh. Prices are reasonable and the service is good with carts coming around regularly. The staff speaks English very well here and can answer any food questions. I've never had a bad meal here.

If you're craving dim sum in Vegas, this place in Chinatown is okay. It's not the cleanest; it's kind of dimly lit, but the food is not bad. I received room temperature Shuimai (the crab cakes wrapped in wonton wrappers); NOT a good sign. However, their tofu dessert (Dofuhua) was pretty good. Overall, their food is just average in temperature (never "fresh"), taste and price.

Service is good for a Chinese restaurant. Everyone is nice and greets you when you enter and leave. They speak English which was a plus. Dim sum is pricey compared to most places I went to... about $3.80. Servings are small.

This place is so dirty. It's ridiculous. They obviously don't change their table cloths under the glass at the tables after each party leaves because there are sauce stains on most of the table cloths. So gross. Service sucked also.   Don't go to this place unless you want to eat at a dirty ass place.

Dim Sum so sad it will make you cry like a little baby that just had dim sum so bad even a little baby knows it's bad. Waaaaaaaaaa.   If you never ate Dim Sum before you would leave thinking Dim Sum is short for Diminished Sumthing.

The food was good. The service was superior. My litmus test for dim sum is shu mai. Harbor Palace dim sum was comparatively larger than most. It was 3 bite shu mai, light on black mushroom and flavor but still good. I also had their tripe and turnips, another good dish if I'd had room I would have had the wine blanched tripe.  It's definitely worth a visit. I was pleasantly surprised to find a female chef showcased on the wall. I'd pass on the noodles and soy sauce. They were dry and unremarkable. Save your stomach real estate for one of their tastier dishes. The staff was really nice and welcoming. I'll go back for sure.

It smelled very funny inside. Everything we tried to order was very slow coming out or they didn't have it. We ordered dim sum at night. They served everyone else around us even though we were seated first. Overall it was an unpleasant experience.

I was headed home from Vegas and was Hangry. I gases up and H.P. Was around the corner.  They were cooking and it smelled great. Sometimes I let my nose make eating decisions for me. Not always a good idea.  This place needs serious cleaning. My shirt was sticking to the chair..............Ewwwwww  Ok, really I felt like getting up and leaving but The Saue Mai was tasty and I was close to death food wise so I stayed............and prayed.  Well I'm still alive n well so as they say. Prayer works.  Ah, I won't be here again. You can if you're a good at praying.

Went there again with some people who had to have dim sum and we were in the chinatown plaza, so I  can tell you nothing but their portion and prices have changed, and not for the better. they continue to recycle food, just watch them when they clear a table, if theres good food left over, they will not throw it away, and will service to someone else!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

So we stopped in here for some Dim Sum Cantonese Style.   After only 2 carts, I was able to get all of my favorites.  I love it because all you have to do is point and they serve it to you. It helps that I speak Cantonese, so I was able to request my favorite, but I can see how this would be frustrating to others who are not familiar with Dim Sum.   Yes, they do have chicken feet.  Unless you can read Chinese, chances are you won't be able to read the check and know exactly how much it will cost you, or know the actual name of the item that you ordered. Meh.  Sometime's I'd rather not know.   I thought this was a great place for Dim Sum, but it certainly is not a good place for Dim Sum beginners without an old Chinese person or a seasoned Dim Sum eater.

We stumbled into this place while on the way to another Cantonese restaurant I chose.  My uncle saw it and remembered it from his last visit and decided to go there.  Big mistake (and I guessed he figured that out too, especially after he went to Wing Lei).    The service was not so hot and the food was pretty bad.  I wouldn't want to go back at all.  There was just nothing to say good about this place perhaps except that the people were trying to be nice (even though they didn't really know how).
Lousy food.  Tasteless Wonton soup and Peking Duck with greasy soft leathery skin.  Avoid the restaurant!

Terrible food. Terrible sweet and sour sauce that smelled like steak sauce.   MY FRIENDS FORTUNE COOKIE DIDNT EVEN HAVE A FORTUNE IN IT!! Haha no fortune at this place.    Only reason they are getting 2 stars is because my lemonade was made in house which was the only thing I enjoyed here.

Wow. The food was Good and the price was meh. When they saw us order alot of food they gave us a dish of fried rice for FREE!!! When you check in you get one free egg roll. THEY GAVE US THREE!!!! The waiters were nice and told us alot of info about the food. There is a lot of space to maneuver and get food at ease. I recommend you to come to this restaurant.
Yes the food experience was very good. Dim sum plus menu items. Plenty of star to help You in every way. Tofu dish was excellent. Recommend if I China Town enjoy this Chinese stop!

It's nothing to be wowed about but for a decent price you get your dim sum fix fast. The service has always been good for me. The people were nice and always gave you ice water without asking.  It's not dim sum from San Francisco so if you come in not expecting that, it's not too bad at all.

When ever I visit Las Vegas, I will definitely come here for my Dim Sim fix. The Dim Sum here is of high quality Hong Kong style. Order the Chow Mien.  It's full of flavour.   Prices are reasonable. And the Service is good.

Place is a old, foods were ok, not enough servers working for this Thanks Giving holiday dim sum. Waited a long time for everything. Servers were not very happy keep saying sorry too busy. We didn't even get our hot mustard sauce we asked for when we just sat down. :-)

Delicious Delicuous Delicious!!! The roasted duck was a dream!!! Great servings and we live that all the plates are shareable portions. We're from out of town, but if we come back, we're coming here! So good!

This is our go to restaurant in Chinatown.  Best for dinner and especially late night, dim sum is OK considering it is Las Vegas. Our favorite is the fish porridge, in general they are a safe bet.  Price is very reasonable considering this is Vegas and you are 5 minutes from the strip.  Surprised that they get rated so low, well we know what we like.

Dim sum is not the best here and dinner entrees are on the ok side.   A lot of tourist go here because it's the only dim sum restaurant in the China Town/strip area, so on weekends, it can get busy.  Late night dining is available. A few times, I ordered the won ton noodle soup-that was good!
Fast service i order the lobster dish with noodles buy one get one free awesome and it was good I will be back to try some dim sum !!!!!
This place is great we will definitely be back again and again and again! They also have a late night menu that looks good too! We ordered the family dinner B. Everything was perfect! 5 stars

I hate giving 1 star, but the place is dirty!  YUCK YUCK YUCK!  I hate finding this out after I ate, but that's when I went to the restroom and wish I hadn't seen all the dirt on the walls, floors and I could see into the kitchen, YIKES!  Where's Kitchen Nightmares?  The food, tasted OK, but nothing super or special.  The service was quick and good.  But I can't get over the place being DIRTY!  YUCK YUCK YUCK....ICKY POO POO!  NONONONO Not again....

This is always our favorite food stand at the Chinatown Plaza's Chinese New Year celebration, which we have been attending for the past nine years. We love their dim sum dishes; everything is tasty, perfectly cooked, and the variety is wonderful. Prices are very reasonable, so we order a little of everything and are never disappointed. We are planning on going to the actual restaurant soon:)

It was ridiculous! Came in at 9:00 just wanted their steam rice noodle rolls, but the owner said it won't be ready until 9:30. I came back again around 10:00 and ordered steam rice noodle rolls and cup of Hot soy milk take out. It took around 5 mins to get me the rice noodle rolls which is reasonable; however, after 25 mins later, they brought me a COLD soy milk where they got from their refrigerator (I saw it), REALLY?! The lady told me it is "warm". PISSED ME OFF completely and won't come again!!!

I would give this place zero stars. Servers were miserable and unfriendly and the place was absolutely filthy! And I just looked and found them on dirty dining. I couldn't believe how disgusting it was. Don't eat there!

AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! If you want yummy tasting dim sum or Chinese food!  If you're in the area, go up stairs and eat at Pho Vietnam instead. It'll be so worth it, believe me.   For my first and last visit, I went with a group of 8 and we were literally only there for not even 15 minutes.   Food - ordered dimsum, all tasted off or bland.   Service - ***BEWARE of the owner/manager...if you don't leave tip, she will ask for tip. That's the first time I ever heard anyone from an establishment question you why you didn't leave a tip. Tip is voluntarily and we weren't happy with the service or food, so you're not entitled to leave extra money. Smh.  Place - out dated and dusty.

WhooooEverrr... gave them more than 1 star you should be ashamed of yourself!..  the dim sum was horrible.. I am in from LA and driving around looking for Chinese food.. didn't want to do any more food on the strip.. My friend and I had to do some shopping so we went to Chinatown.. wanted the usual hole in the wall place.... someone come help me just dig them a hole back to China...who is with me on this...?!. the best thing there was the steamed Chinese broccoli...  If I am in the hospital and in a coma from food poisoning, let them know that I ate here..... please pray for me

I had a craving for dim sum during one of my regular weeklong vegas trips, and i've tried other restaurants in the strip mall this place resides, so we gave it a go.  The dining room is pretty rundown and the tables and chairs looked like they had been through the ringer a couple times.    On to the food.  The carts zipped around pretty quickly, and i was pleasantly surprised that the service was clutch.  I was seated furthest away from the carts so i had to get up every time to see what they had.  Despite that, good service i must say.  I will list the foods (some with my patented terrible description) that i liked and didn't like:  Likes: -chicken feet - i like to eat these things, but i think it's cooler to watch other peoples' grossed-out expressions when i do eat them -smelt - surprisingly flavorful -spare rib - tender and tasty -shrimp dumpling - basic but good -the flat thing that tasted like shrimp and looked like an egg, also good  Drinking haterade: -all egg rolls were bland and blech -calamari just ok -the steam rolls i had were kinda cold and blech -other dumplings we ordered (not shrimp), take a pass  So some good and not so good things here, thus my useless 3 star rating.  I will continue my vegas dim sum search to other places, though i may come back here.

Sunday night for dinner here and it's a joke.   The restaurant is very run down and outdated.   Service? HA! I could have served myself. It's ridiculous, unprofessional and annoying. We've waited 40 mins for our food. I asked our server what's taking our food so long and she said it's crowded tonight. No it's not. Half the restaurant is full.   Food was just mediocre, not even good plus it didn't even give the runs so it's not too bad.  Nothing impressive.
This restaurant was better than what people reviewed. Good service, decent food, very affordable, and some what clean.  You are in the Chinese restaurant. Don't look for super clean.

Last time a year ago told myself I will not be back, food didn't taste fresh. I had the roasted duck, I can clearly see it was not fresh and taste like it was reheated. hai gow tastes old. I recall I can smell a foul scent coming from the restroom as I entered.   During this visit my friends suggested to have dim sum before our drive home.  We followed them from behind, as we patiently waited to  signal  to turn into the parking lot. I told my husband "No!, not here".  My supportive husband all he can do was laugh. Here I am dragging myself to get out the car and hubby tugging me along. Yup! still dirty nasty carpet, this time I didn't get a whiff of the bathroom smell. We were greeted by two friendly staff at the front door.   My friends did all the ordering, there were 7 of us they each pointed / asked what they want from the dim sum cart. I decline my request. kept thinking why am I back here again. Than reality hits me. its because for the company of great friendship.  I ate the steamed Chinese broccoli, fried garlic snow pea leaves. it was good. Decided to try the hai gow again, yes! still taste rotten, old meat. the chicken feet was ok? we all thought it lacked flavors.  5 of 7 had the same thought the  fried chicken wings were really salty, it was left unfinished. My girlfriend whispered to me she didn't like the hai gow " it taste spoiled".  3 stars for the service provided and giving us a chance to connect with one another. The next time someone recommend this place again. I will slap them silly.

3 months ago I came here and to my suprise the food that I order tasted different and the soup was tasteless. I found out that all the cooks when back to China and hired new cooks. Stay away guys the place sucks now

Dont let the lady scare you while first seating yourselves while she shouts asking what type of drinks you would like to order, LOL. The glass door was left open and my dinner pal became pretty uncomfortable with the cool breeze heading in our table direction. I went ahead and closed the glass door while my dinner pal was in the restroom. Several hosts placed pickled cabbage as an appetizer and left us with a teapot with green tea. Once I checked in on yelp this place offered 1 free egg roll. Out of the three of us with ordering: orange peeled chicken, roasted duck, scrambled shrimp/egg, fried scallop rice ranged to be around $50.
The best ever I recomend every family go and try this original Chinese restaurant the best noodles

I'm not really sure what the rest of the dim sum scene is like in LV, but I thought this place was pretty good. We waited about 5 minutes for a table on Sunday around noon and although the dining room is pretty small compared to the giant places in SoCal, it was pretty packed. There was a decent selection and I found all my favorites including a few new ones like the roast pork. I just wish they had one of those carts that grilled up the radish cakes instead of putting them in the steamer.   The 4 of us ate until we were stuffed and the bill was only $32! I think this is a great option when you've had enough with the buffets and just want something different. Plus they're open from 10 AM to 5 AM which is crazy, even by San Gabriel Valley standards!

My friends and I were in Vegas for a week and like true Asians we started to crave Chinese food. We heard from a local that this place served awesome dim sum. The next time I meet up with her in NYC, I am bringing her straight to Flushing or Chinatown so that she can compare the difference. Despite the service being prompt and friendly, the quality of the dim sum just could not meet my expectations. The zha liang was not crispy and the sauce for the Xia Chang Fen was pouring more fluidly than our tea. Don't get me wrong, the food is not bad. I enjoyed the meal and it did not break the bank. However, if you truly want to experience great dim sum, travel out of Las Vegas.
Fantastic, authentic Chinese food.  Big portions. Very tasty.  Will definitely return.

This is my go-to late night chinese food fix restaurant. usually order salt n pepper shrimp (no head, no shell) or salt n pepper pork chops or Mongolian beef or beef broccoli or beef chow fun or I dont know what else. But I of all the times I've eaten here, never had any bad food. Everything tasted good and since we were there late, never had a problem with service. I recommend this place for dinner anytime.

Une adresse que nous aimons! Service rapide, plats copieux pour un prix raisonnable. Pour deux personnes 32$, 1/2 canard rti, un riz cantonais poisson sal et un plat de lgumes varis sauts et un plat de eggs roll offert par Offre spciale Yelp ! Que du bonheur avec un bon th chaud,  vraiment bien. L'ambiance est simple et confortable,  le restaurant a t agrablement rnov.  Un restaurant ou nous reviendrons  chacun de nos passages  Las Vegas.
Food was pretty mediocre and service stinks. They seem to rush you thru everything from seating you to serving you dim sum.  I will definitely not return to this place.
Nice place, good service, good food. The only thing is they don't give us more sweet and sour sauce hahaha. The prices are good and it's a lot of food. It's good for late dining they close at 5am

The dim sum is good but the waiter service is not great at all. The wait time was absurd because we waited 20 minutes but there were many tables available. The dim sum service was not good because the waiter would not listen to us and would ignore us. Overall I would rate the service a 4/10. Plus, the ambience is good but you can hear a lot of noises in the kitchen which distracts the restaurant setting.

Didn't try the dim sum. I had a hot pot instead. A few points:  Rice is extra, only 80 cents, but extra all the same. Not a place you go to for that chinese dinner combo with the soup and egg roll included.  Not particularly clean.  $20 min for credit cards. All things I expect in a more traditional chinese restaurant.  At any rate, bean curd and mushroom hot pot was actually quite good.  I didn't see any carts going around with dim sum, so I wasn't able to try any, or maybe I was supposed to ask for a special menu? I don't know, but I'd like to come back and try the dim sum next.

Servers were great but the food was gross. Chicken was over cooked and the shrimp had a strange taste. The dim sum was the worse part. Every part I tried tasted old. I love seafood and Chinese food so I thought this would be the perfect place. I was wrong.

More like a 3.5. Honestly, I left happy with my meal. I wasn't expecting much since I have had dim sum all my life and this place is in Nevada. The fact that it is located in Chinatown was a little concerning since I tend to think overrated and Chinatown, but this strip on Chinatown was crazy jam packed with Asian restaurants. The decor is very typical dim sum restaurant and is also very typical Chinese service. FYI, the bathroom is not good, so if you can hold off, you should.  The food:  Churn Fun with Shrimp- The crepe was more thick noodle like but still had good flavor. It was good.  Churn Fun with Spare Ribs- Similar to the above but I was expecting the spare ribs to be more tender. The flavor was good.  Pie Kwat- This spare rib is the same as the above, good flavor but needed to be more tender.  Don Tot- I really enjoyed the flavor and texture of the egg tart, this is a must get.  Sesame Ball with Lotus Paste- I never get this but a member of my group ordering it and it was great. The outer dough had a perfect chew and the lotus paste had a nice sweetness and nice smooth consistency. Highly recommend.  Bell Pepper with Shrimp Paste- It was good but not a terribly exciting dish.  Dow Meow- or Snow Pea Leaf for $15.95. I really liked the flavor, it is pricey but this is the same price as New York but it was flavorful and tender. I would get this again.   Pork Congee with Thousand Year Egg- It was respectable, the flavor is subtle but the pork and egg adds nice flavor.  Braised Tofu Skin- These seemed on the small side but the flavor was decent.  Shumai- This was bad, it was dry and grainy, I would totally skip this. This was the only thing that I really didn't like, everything else was good or really good.

The food and service are just OK here, but the prices are pretty cheap.  My boyfriend and I had some dim sum dishes and shared the Kung Pao Chicken.  The bill was under $30.  So, we paid a modest amount for a very average meal.  Go here if you are on a tight budget, particularly if you have lost at the casinos.

First impressions. This place is dark, dank, and depressing. Inattentive customer service, even allowing for lowered expectations for a Chinese restaurant. Waitress checking her watch as we order. Dim Sum average at best. Or at least what we were able to try. After our initial order, the carts just powered past us and our outstretched arms. No more for you round eye! Do yourself a favor and research dishes here on YELP before visiting. Know there are six pages of Chinese language menu and very rudimentary English descriptions.
dim sum is great quality... the place is nice.  We always have a great experience with the restaurant. We recommend it because we always come here for good food and experience.

This was probably the worst restaurant experience I have ever had in my life. I went with four of my friends and we patiently sat and waited for somebody to take our order for 15 minutes. When the women finally came up she said "what do you want" and when the second person started to order she said "hurry up I don't have all night" we waited probably a half hour for our food and they just never brought out two of the plates. And when we asked about them the guy rolled his eyes and came back 10 minutes later with them. When we went up front to pay our waitress walked up to us and said "where's my tip, gimme tip" ARE YOU KIDDING ME? If that's how you think you run a business you're very wrong. I have no problem tipping for good service, but after that night you all don't deserve a penny

As the only Chinese food place that came up on Uber Eats I ordered a pretty serious amount of food - not only did it take over an hour, but it's so bad it's completely inedible.  It's pretty hard to mess up pot stickers and friend rice. It somehow they managed.

Was craving some dim sum so went for dim sum on a Sunday after noon around 130pm.  I'm from Maryland so we have some decent  dimsum I'm places. This is probably not as good as back in maryland. If u could I would give it 2.5 stars. They have dim sum on carts. We tried the typical dim sum foods. We had har gow, siu mai, chiu chow fun gwor, rice wrapped in banana leaf, shrimp crepes (??), spare ribs, shrimp balls...The best things to get here was the fried shrimp balls, spare rib, siu mai, and rice wrapped in banana leaf. The rest was so so. The biggest disappointment was the har gow. The thin was too thick. Should be crystal like and shrimp flavorful. There was no flavor. Service wasn't bad. Restaurant wasn't too busy so the carts came around quite often. Had to ask for water refills though.

Service is pretty bad, food is very good. This place is one of the few places in town that does daily dim sum, so i've been here quite a few times. Lots of ultra traditional dishes, so be sure you know what you're ordering or you may be in for a surprise.
I'm pretty sure the only reason anyone comes here is because it's the only thing available at 3AM. The food is terrible. Terrible. I repeat..terrible. Avoid at all cost!

Terrible terrible terrible...been going here for many years, always for Dim Sum.  This place has been slowly going down hill but today was the final straw.  Service was horrible.  Selection was even worse...they had one steam cart and one fried cart for the entire place.  The steamed ones were dry and waaayyyyy over done.  Definitely go someplace else.

It's a great place for late night after hours and you suddenly crave that dimsum. The place is big, a lot of seats, servers are friendly and food is made fresh since it takes a while when you order. It does hit the spot, and prices are acceptable. I do recommend people to visit the place. I do have another favorite spot, but this is acceptable for me if the other one is closed.

It's sad when you go to eat dim sum and they don't even have the basics. I've been eating dim sum for over 30 years of my life and never once have I ever been treated as rudely and as disrespectful as I was treated here. Me and my mother and my sister came here to eat one morning and we were greeted with the most rudest of attitudes. When we asked one of the servers that was pushing a cart around did she have certain things we don't serve that here in a rude and nasty tone. We asked our server for basic condiments such as hot mustard chili and she got an attitude with us. Overall to put the icing on the cake I brought it to Management's attention about the rudeness and the lack of customer service and basically got Shrugged off did not receive an apology no type of discount. So for all you out-of-towners that come looking for good dim sum I would not recommend this place at all. Going forward me and my family will take our business elsewhere since you guys do not know how to treat customers with the respect. So for all use that are reading this please never eat here or go here unless you just want rude and bad service and maybe after they read this I'll finally get an apology for the rudeness that me and my mother and my sister experience there.

The setting was definelty shady with the dim lights. The waitress was kind of rushing us to buy more food and told my dad the wrong price for the fish. She said $20, but it was actually $25. In addition, she seemed really hesitant to give me the free egg rolls, which I found odd. The food was above average for a Chinese restaurant and the food was mediocre. But it's alright, I give then a 2 star because of the old lady gave us good service and tip them $11.

They have a banner outside stating "Best Chinese in Vegas - 2015"  What a lie.  Worst meal I had in Vegas, worst dim sum I've ever had, and they charged me $17 for the 2 plates I tried, but couldn't finish because they were COLD. Ponder that statement: Cold food in Vegas in June.

Although i have been here a few times, my last visit for dinner here was so bad that i dont think I will ever go again. Some of the dishes had no salt...few of them were extremely salty. Overall it was crappy. Their dim sum is ok.

This place has changed over the years or do they not serve good food unless its the weekend.  We came on a Monday with a large group for dim sum. The shui Mai was ok. The dumplings were ok. The pork ribs were ok. The rice congee was ok. The steamed shrimp with rice noodles were day old that were warmed up with watered down soy sauce. It was gross. The chicken feet were cooked in a vinegar sauce and that was awful. The shrimp ball was old tasting too.  They use to be very good for dim sum but what happened? I feel bad but it must of been the case of the Monday's. lol. Don't think I will return for dim sim here. :(

We usually stop for dim sum here every time we are in Vegas.  The restaurant is in China town and has plenty of parking.  They serve dim sum every day!  The dim sum selection is excellent...they have special items like fried smelt when available.  Everything has been very good except maybe the beef tendons which I normally love.  The prices are great.  The service can be a little hit and miss.

This place is AWESOME -LY HORRIBLE! I honestly wished I drove the extra mile and went to Cathay House.  This visit will actually keep me from returning.  Dim sum selection were very minimal.  Wait time for drinks was bad.  And when I asked for a specific dim sum the lady looked at her cart and took off without answering my question! WTH!  So with that being said... happy eatings!... else where! :D

We're driving around looking for dim sum restaurant and we found harbor palace restaurant . First one lady come out point us to the table , when we about to sit another lady tell us to go to different table can hold eight person and our family had 9 adults and two kids . Dim sum restaurant but they said they don't have shrimp dumplings , and everything els taste like they made from yesterday , bad service , bad food .

I came here with my family of 4. we came at 9:50 am and there were 2 tables already here. Right when we sat down they asked us what to drink and rushed us to pick our dim sum before we even poured our tea. My dad asked to give us a second to drink our tea first and the staff started giving us attitude. They neglected us and we're talking to each other (a lot of cussing btw).  The food was the usual but extra strong in MSG and starch. my spareribs and cow stomach was covered in starch. small portions for expensive price. I won't recommend anyone to come.
There wasn't anything good about this place. The dim sum dishes were tasteless and cold. The servers were also very rude and had a bad attitude when asked for anything.

i cant eat seafood so i cant say how the seafood was but my friends loved it and it was a place they wanted to go so it was a great meal. i was able to eat some beef and pork dim sum dishes and they were good. i also ordered orange chicken and it was pretty good not the best ive had but it was good for 10$. service was fast here on the food side, i did have to tell someone consistently we needed drinks. lol we were eating before we had water. all in all this place is pretty good and located in a great area. if you're a tourist which most people will be this place is located in an asian mall area and if you need some souvenirs walk in the mall and just shop at the little stores, anime galore! haha

We come here almost every year when we make our annual trip for a basketball tournament. They advertise that they have dim sum everyday, but we always go for dinner. Restaurant hours are certainly accommodating to late-night gamblers: 10 AM - 5 AM. They have a couple of separate banquet rooms which can accommodate large groups -- hopefully you won't need one at the same time a tour bus pulls in.  On our latest trip, we had: fish fillet with black bean sauce, string beans with minced meat, shrimp w/ lobster sauce, deep fried salted & spicy squid, the house special chow mein, orange peel chicken, and eggplant w/ garlic sauce hotpot.  The good: the string beans were fresh & crisp, and the eggplant hotpot was very tasty. The Hong Kong-style chow mein was very good as well.  The bad: fried squid was unremarkable and the chicken in the orange peel chicken was tough & chewy.  The ugly: the fish fillet w/ black bean sauce & the shrimp w/ lobster sauce both had way too much brown/white onion. The shrimp w/ lobster sauce had only six shrimp, and the lobster sauce had pieces of pork, which is something I haven't seen before. The flavor for both dishes was good, but just not enough fish or shrimp in each.  Overall, the food is probably pretty good for Las Vegas as far as being authentically Chinese, but the quality of some dishes isn't as good as you'd find in a community with a large Chinese population (i.e., LA or SF).

Their selection of dim sum wasn't as large or there want much of a selection.  Had to order the Chinese broccoli since it didn't come out on the cart. The pork potstickers had no taste so we didn't finish eating it.  They didn't really understand English either.  Wouldn't go back again.

Go to McDonald's or Taco Bell. The bad reviews here are true. My taxi cab driver told me this was the best Chinese Food in Las Vegas. I didn't believe him of course but I thought that it would be an authentic Chinatown experience. I specifically did not read any online reviews prior to going, thinking that if it wasn't the best, it would be average, good Chinese food. The space itself is fine. The entire staff is disorganized but no one was rude. The menu is primitive, long, and confusing. They need to be thrown out and redone. The quality of the food was uniformly poor. We ordered the #3 dinner special. They put out very bad appetizers and soup and forgot about the entree. I didn't eat the chicken or shrimp because they looked disgusting. I couldn't bring myself to snap a photo because I thought that I would gag if I looked at it. The fried rice had some visible lard on it. Just to sum it up, the service is confused (in a big way) and really bad food. They were not busy when I went and I did not try the dim sum. I will never go back here.
Food is okay if you like seafood .... Potions are not bad. Scallop tofu and whole steam fish and crab/lobster noddle special are good!

We come here with my cousin from Calgary who was visiting. I did not check out reviews before I came here, we were kind of in a hurry to find a place for dinner so I suggested this place. They have dim sum everyday, and hours are from 10 AM - 5 AM. They have banquet rooms which can accommodate large groups.  We had quite a few variety which I don't remember. Large selections on the menu.  The server did not understand much english. Overall, I thought the food was good.
Good service.  Always consistent.  Its irritating seeing others bash it.  If their expectations are THE PALM then pay THE PALM prices.

Friends and I sometimes make an early morning "dinner" here after a night dancing in Goldcoast. As it is convenient and still open until 5 a.m. (from 10a.m. for 7 days of the week). There is no wait to get seated. The host sits us on any table we prefer on either table setting or booth-type seating. Sometimes,a few or no diners at this hours of early morning. Food service is quick to moderate wait.   Noticeably, the menu have Chinese characters as well as below the English food titles are Filipino language translations. Is it because the owners are also of Filipino heritage or is it that the restaurant's dining patrons are predominantly Filipino? Interesting.  A wide variety of entree in the menu consisting of appetizer, soup, various seafood entrees (shark's fin, abalone, sea cucumber, lobster, crab, geoduck clam, scallop, shrimp, clam, oyster, squid, fish), various fowl entrees (squab, duck, chicken), beef, pork, vegetable, bean curd, fried rice, hot pot, sizzling plate, noodle entrees. Spicy Items are indicated. The usual soup I order each time I dine here is "Fish Maw with Crab Meat Soup" which is filled with fish and crab meat in a flavorful thickened broth. Hot Pots are generous and steaming hot. Oyster is also another favorite item ordered which are large-sized. Never overcooked.   Family Dinner Combinations are also available starting from $12.95 - $17.95. A Special Lunch menu served 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Mondays to Fridays Only at $5.95 is a good deal to have which includes soup of the day, an egg roll and fried rice. Sometimes, this is an order I make when in the vicinity of "Chinatown", conveniently packed in a styrofoam box on a take-out request.  Just not expect quick attention to your needs, the servers seem to be preocuppied with something else when you need to get their service.

The food was not too bad, but the service was practically non-existent. It took so long for someone to come take our order we almost left. We had to flag down a server for anything we needed after. Maybe it was a little busy but maybe stop by to check on diners at some point? I have literally had better service at some fast food places. When wait staff did interact with us, it was perfunctory and made us feel like we were imposing on them. Looking around the restaurant, not even a smile to attempt to make diners feel welcome. The food like I said was pretty good but the experience will keep me from returning or recommending. There are too many options in Las Vegas to put up with that again.

Its a pretty typical chinese seafood restaurant. Been to worse been to better. One comment is that their food is way too salty for my taste buds and i can taste alot of mag used in the process. The service was decent as well. I can see that they are trying but some are inexperienced waiters... Took like 15 mins after we sat down to get our order taken. But if you really want some chinese food, its not a terrible option.

This place is open till 5am but I'm not sure if it's the best time to try out their food. Our big bowl of jook didn't have much preserved egg and the shredded pork in it was rather dry. The texture of the porridge was on the thinner side and had an odd anise flavor.  Dry fried beef ho fun was on the oily side and the noodles seemed more al dente than they should be.  On choy was nicely cooked and seasoned very well, my favorite dish.

The reviews don't lie. Unfortunately I didn't yelp fast enough before my family walked in and got seated. Service is awful and I know that's expected but it was even worse than I imagined. These ladies walk up to your table expressionless and speechless as if you can see through the damn tin dishes to order from their cart. A staring contest ensues until you ask... So what do you have? After a while, the ladies started flashing some smiles and we noticed it was because they were looking at our infant son. So if you want slightly friendlier service, bring a baby with you.   Food was "passable" as my hubby put it. He liked the chive and pork dumplings and not much else. I was taught to leave with at least one positive thought, so hmm... Egg tarts came out hot and fresh as we were about to leave, so that made up for the experience a teeny tiny bit. Also, the person who brought us our check who may or may not have been the owner, was super duper friendly and sweet. She said "please join us again soon!" She gave us some coupon and commented on how cute the kids were. Okay, I shall give you TWO stars.

Traditional style chinese restaurant, located in its own place at the edgr of vegas chinatown. Decor is plain and old, as well as the china. But some of our best meals have been in these types of places so we gave it a shot.  Service - Waitress didn't even give us two minutes to sit down before she asked what we wanted to order. We had to call her away 3 times since we were still looking at the menu... she could benefit from a lesson in learning body language. We ordered 6 things, only 5 came out. Which was good in the long run because it was too much food anyways.   Seafood soup bit salty but decent. Chewy.   Sweet and sour fried fish was done very well. Crispy fresh fishsteaks drizzled with yummy sauce. Similar taste to squirrel fish.   General Tso chicken (my banana sister wanted this) tasted exactly like a mediocore replica of the fish dish above, except with dry chicken pieces. Disappointing.  Veggies - they ran out of the ones we wanted so we tried asking about a different type (but very popular) mushroom dish. They looked confused and did not understand, maybe from a different part of china? We did not get what we wanted, but a much slimier kind of mushroom.   Chow Fun (seriously I dont know why my parents let her choose the menu so american) - very oily, HeFuns were pieces rather than long strands, making it difficult to eat.   Decent seafood but mediocore in everything else. Almost no other chinese in the restaurant, probably should have known. Oh well.
Their foods are really shitty, I got food poisoning here and I can't even stop throwing up and shitting like AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU CAN

The service here is terrible. Charged us for a soda we never got then when I said something when we got the bill they just minus the cost of the soda not the tax. I left no tip because we didn't get any service. We had to call someone to take our order we had to actually had to get up to get the bill and other than dropping the food off at our table we saw no one. The food was just ok and I have never ordered spare ribs before and got them boiled with nothing left on the bone. A waste of $40 for just two people.

This is a dim sum review only.  Sis and I were craving us some dim sum on Sunday morning in Las Vegas.  The hotel recommended Harbor Palace Seafood Restaurant because "many of our guests liked it".  I'm not sure if their guests had much experience with dim sum because our meal was pretty disappointing.  Not that I've got that much experience with dim sum, but...  First of all, I love Las Vegas.  The city originally didn't have a Chinatown.  No problem!  They built a couple of strip malls on Spring Mountain Road and slapped pagoda roofs on them and asian businesses set up shop.  Now there is a proliferation of chinese, thai, korean and some japanese shops, bakeries and restaurants along Spring Mountain.  if you build it, they will come!  Harbor Palace is a large restaurant in (I think) one of the original strip malls.  The interior is very basic restaurant decor, without much in the way of fancy wall hangings or artistic pieces that you see in some Chinese restaurants.  But basic is okay and sometimes a good thing, if the food is good.  Sis and I were seated by the hostess and  served a lo mein dish (not sure if this is complimentary or not, more later).  We were being eyeballed by three cart ladies, who were standing with their dim sum carts a few feet away from our table.  After we have been sitting for a few minutes, each cart lady rolls her cart out of our area and disappears. The carts looked pretty full before they left so I don't know if they were serving other tables or reloading or what. By the time they get back to us and we've chosen our food, items are lukewarm at best.  The shiumai and the steamed wontons tasted pretty similar and everything was dry.  The steamed barbecue pork buns were okay but not hot.  There were a coiuple of other things that were fine but nothing that really stood out.  We passed on the chicken feet and porridge and ribs.  There were also other choices, such as seseme steamed buns and rice, but it didn't seem like a vast amount of choices.  We finished up quickly and got out after paying the bill which seemed reasonable but it was all in Chinese, so I'm not sure exactly what we got or whether the noodles we had were added to the bill.   Next time we will do a little more research, instead of relying on what "other guests" liked .

It's a shame. The food was great but the management is a joke, and the service is non existent. We ordered one of their select combinations which includes an appetizer, soup, rice, and a couple proteins. We ordered one consisting of beef and chicken. Turns out they dropped off someone else's entree to our table. No one said what the dish was or even bothered to stop back by until the other table questioned the where abouts of their food. Management came to my table insisting I pay for the dish we didn't order or eat. It wasn't even the correct dish for the other table. There's plenty of places in the area with good food as well, but it be a task to find a place with such poor etiquette as Harbor Palace.  Dine else where!

Definitely wait to come here after 11:30 a.m. If you arrive early like I did at 10:45 a.m. everything they're serving isn't fresh. The first 3-4 dishes we ate were cold and disappointing. But once they start pushing around the fresh dim sum carts, the food is pretty decent. Just keep your expectations low and do not order the Wonton Noodle Soup (it's not worth the $7). I wouldn't eat here again if I could help it, supposedly there are better dim sum places in Vegas.

This was some serious good eating! I wasn't aware of Vegas' dim sum scene, but this place offers simple, traditional, tasty and pretty good service of dim sum for the area. The prices are very reasonable!   They have the little push carts that go around and that's a rareity to see these days in many of the new dim sum tea houses. It does help to speak the language (Cantonese or Mandarin), as the ladies on the carts will be more attentive to what you want to try or eat.   We ordered the usual items like ha gor (shrimp dumpling), siu mai, steamed pork bun, chicken feet (yes!), pork ribs, congee with preserved duck egg and some other items.  We fed a party of 3 for only $40 - not bad! And, we were full at the end of our meal.   The decor is a bit old school, so don't expect to be wow-ed by the restaurant's looks. Parking can be tough on the weekends, but there is a big lot. You just have to drive around a bit to find a spot. Otherwise, this place is a steal.  I would definitely come back again!

pros... one of the few dim sum places we found in las vegas.  i'm sure there were more, but this one was the one we went to.  close to the strip, lots of parking, a big aquarium with a few gold fish, somewhat helpful waitresses.    now about the food.  i would come here mostly for the steamed foods.  so the har gaw, pork shumai, cha shu baos, and the steamed rolls.  the egg custard tart was also so good.  the only fried item on the list that made it was the fried sesame balls, which we only tried the yellow bean one, cause they do offer a black bean sesame oblong as well.  the best thing was the sweet silken tofu dessert, which was spot on, and is probably the best tasting, well syrup wise, that i have had.  it was smooth, light, soft and very warm.  the syrup was just the right sweetness without being too sweet, and the ginger taste was perfect.     cons... well where should i begin.  well the place was a bit run down, carpets need a steaming, the chairs and tables were also very run down.   neon sign not working, and the windows were pretty greasy.    the wait staff must have been afraid of me and the wife with the boxes of chinese herbal medicines on the table, or were they just ignoring us for the first 10 minutes.  but then they came by and it was good from there.    the fried foods were disappointing, egg rolls were soggy, no sauce with them.  fried noodles also no sauce to accompany them.  somewhat a bit greasy with the fried foods, sounds wrong but if you fry things correctly you get very light and relatively oil free foods.  think of a good tempura, which is light and not greasy at all.  enough said.  all in all just a 3 star place.  when i go back in november i'm finding the other dim sum place in las vegas.

Stereotypical Cantonese style Chinese food.   Came here for late night dinner one night with family and friends. It was the only restaurant open in this plaza after 11pm. We were seated right away and the manager came over right away and took our order. We ordered about 6 dishes to share between 5 of us.   The food came out really quickly, and everything tasted very authentic, a bit greasy and salty though. The dishes are medium to smaller portions compared to the normal size at chinese restaurants, and the prices are higher as well. The service was quick but absent at times.   Nothing fancy, just fill up when you are hungry.
The dim sum here is the best t tasting I  have had in Vegas! Seriously y'all, try it!

The ONE star rating this place earned is for the non-smoking atmosphere.  And that's it!!  The bench seat was missing the back half (where your butt & tailbone would touch) of the padding, so the seat was lumpy and had a steep decline.  VERY UNCOMFORTABLE!!  I had to go to my car to get a blanket, roll it up lengthwise, and fill in the crevice so we could eat comfortably.  The ONLY reason why I didn't just get up & leave, which I would have done had it been with other company, was that my 73-year-old aunt wanted to eat here & out of respect, I didn't complain to her.  (I waited to do it here)  Plus she paid.  That was the first bad experience.  The second came when we were greeted at the table rather blankly by our waitress.  Maybe she was having a bad day, maybe that was her personality, whatever; still didn't make my experience any better.  Yes, my aunt has a strong accent, but the waitress couldn't figure out what exactly she wanted even after I tried to explain (I have a North American accent & spoke slowly & articulated my words).  I think my aunt got the food she wanted.  3rd bad experience:  The crab rangoon had curry in it!!  I made crab rangoon before & could have sworn it doesn't have curry in it.  The waitress looked at us through slitted eyes & said that's how they normally make it (curry was not mentioned in the menu).  So I double checked a few websites, and sure enough, NO CURRY in a traditional crab rangoon recipe!  I looked at allrecipes.com, chinesefood.about.com, and damndelicious.net.  My sister told them to take it back, that we didn't want it.  Since our aunt paid the bill, we didn't get to see it (actually forgot to check) to make sure the 2 orders of crab rangoon was taken off the bill.  I hope so.  4th bad experience:  Waited A LLLOOOONG time, each time, to get checked on and for a water refill.  This is even before the crab rangoon incident.  Can't blame it on revengeful, horrendous service.  5th bad experience:  The breaded shrimp is WAY TOO BREADED!!!  When we removed the breading, it almost tripled the size of the shrimp that was lost inside.  6th bad experience:  Price for and taste of food were at opposite ends of the spectrum!!  Guess which ends they belong?  I don't eat at McDonald's anymore, but I know McDonald's food tastes A LOT BETTER!  Needless to say, we will NOT return.  I'm noticing a few one-star reviews to my right as I write this.  I'll steer my auntie somewhere else next time we visit her.  And my sister or I will pay!   THIS IS THE **WORST** RESTAURANT MY SISTER AND I HAVE VISITED!!!!!!!  Actually, I'll read my other posts after posting this and remove the previous statement if I see that I've experienced worse.  If you're still reading this, though, consider yourself warned.  Just so y'all know, I read my one-star reviews of other restaurants.  This takes the cake.  WORST EVER.

I don't know why people hate it so much. From a Chinese perspective, I like it a lot. I'll be here every time I visit LV. Can't remember the service, but food is always counts first. It is absolutely as the same one as I had in China.

Was here for dim sum and lunch. Food was okay, not that great. Serving cup and ice glass were very dirty. Be Careful when they marked on your dim sum card.  The restaurant owner lady have gut to ask my brother in law for tip, but we already left tips on the table, even though they didn't deserve it. Will not come back ! Tip is only courtesy if they deserved it !!!

I came here on a Sunday morning and the line was out the door. I looked over at Sam Woos, and the placed looked like it was closed even though the open sign was lit up. So I decided the food is probably going to be better over here judging by the crowd.   I went up the front, and waited about 5 minutes and never got acknowledged. I was just trying to get a number to get seated. A Chinese couple came up and spoke in cantonese and they were given seating numbers immediately. So I decided to interrupt and ask for a number as well. The asian lady gave me a dirty look, and the Chinese couple were nice enough to say that I was ahead of them and I deserve a number ahead of them. The asian lady refused and still gave me the later number. As I was walking away I heard .. " he jus stan der like a wood, no say nuthin so no numba!"     Hmm so I guess customer service is not exactly their forte here. Since its my last meal in Vegas, and I have been meaning to try some great off the strip Dim Sum, I just had to deal with it.   I was finally seated about 20 minutes later. The dim sum came at us hot and heavy. I was able to get all of my orange county favorites. The taste however was just as not as good as Seafood paradise in Little Saigon, but I would say its better then Cathays in Vegas.  The price of the food is definitely very reasonable. However the tip they earned was not so much. I expect at least to be acknowledged when I want to pay for service next time.   I have dined at Sam Woos and Shang Hais in the same shopping center, but as far as Chinese food goes, this is the most authentic out of them all. I would come here for the food, get abused a little bit then leave with a full stomach and a stink eye at everyone you see in this place.

I had no expectations coming in here as the reviews were pretty low. Harbor Palace is actually home to some pretty decent dim sum. But keep in mind this is coming from a Dallas born-and-raised gal where we do not have great dim sum. My group and I came here around 1pm on Sunday and there was no wait. There were a decent amount of carts rolling around with your typical dim sum dishes. The chili oil was oddly really good. We got the dim sum must-orders: har gow, shu mai, shrimp fun roll, and fried taro. All were delicious and flavorful. We ordered the two different types of tripe and were left pretty underwhelmed. The flavors were lacking and definitely needed the chili oil and soy sauce to amp things up. My group liked the chicken feet. I eat pretty weird things but chicken feet is something I never touch. The radish cake was also tasty. Overall, I liked and enjoyed the dim sum here. Unfortunately it took forever for us to get the check. The service is kinda spotty with but what Asian restaurant actually has good service?

Craved for Chinese Food after a late night shift (10pm). This place is open until 5am! Score. Went here with a friend who actually recommended this place for being good & inexpensive.   Fish maw soup... Delicious! Sauted greens... Amazing! Special fried rice... Scrumptious! And half duck... crispy goodness. To top it off the service was amazing! Very friendly & attentive :) Defiantly will be coming back... What more can you ask for? Friendly staff, good food & amazing prices

Worst experience I've ever had! Really bad service, the guy that works there is very rude and kept mean mugging us and the servers ignored us most of the time! It took them forever to give us a menu and even longer to take our order after that. They didn't give us water till after they gave us our food. And at the end after I paid for everything and was ready to walk out the guy goes "what about tip?" I wasn't planning on giving any with the way they treated us but he kept demanding it so I had no choice. Overall 1 star because the food was really good but will never go back to eat there!

I was in Vegas for work and wanted to get some dim sum.  Reviews on Yelp were so-so but I decided to try it anyways. I am not a picky eater but I would have to say this was the worse dim sum I've ever had and I've been to a lot of dim sum restaurants.  I would not go here again nor would I recommend it to anyone.  Next time I'll try one of the other places in the strip mall.

We wanted to stop by Chinatown before leaving Las vegas. The place is pretty small with three or four carts. They serve typical items at any dim sum but they served pineapple buns with custard which are my favorite. Of course it's not as good as NY but it's decent. The prices were also much more expensive.

After a failed attempt to go to Pho Kim Long for dinner, my family and I decided to eat here.   Big mistake.  This is definitely the worst Chinese restaurant I've ever been to.  My family and I didn't really have a problem with the servers, it was really the food that was quite lackluster.  We ordered dim sum (I want to give an extra star for the fact that they serve dim sum for dinner, but I just can't) off of an already used dim sum order form. We got the siu mai, har gau, shrimp balls and salt & pepper squid. The salt & pepper squid was basically fried squid flavored rings of batter. It was like eating hard squid chips. And that was so disappointing because my family loves well made salt and pepper squid. The siu mai had an odd aftertaste. The only dim sum I thought was okay was the har gau.   A lot of their condiments (soy sauce and chili oil) resided in dirty containers, so we were afraid to use them because they seemed old. The chili oil looked to be more oil or some other liquid than chili, which was kinda gross.   There's also no refills on drinks.  Safe to say that we're never eating here again.
Very, very , very poor service no coordination!!!!I If there 's negative stars , I will put negative 10 stars

Awful! I have been coming here for 10 years! And the food has really suffered it is disgusting to say the least and their ingredients are definitely not fresh.  Even their hot sauce tastes like shit.  I would come here for the food because their service or lack of was not welcoming. unless you like not being acknowledged.  So if you are looking for terrible service where you are ignored and CACA food come here!

1 star for customer service and another star for being open 24 hours and having a menu with various translations.   The food was not very good. It had no flavor whatsoever. The shumai and Chinese broccoli was the only thing that I liked. I ordered a bunch of other dim sum items, but they were very bland with no flavor. Stay away from the pork spareribs.... It tasted like cartilage.. That was overly boiled. I was really disappointed with the food, hence my 2am munchie mission with my gf = complete fail
Limited dim sum selection. Slow and inattentive service. Skip it and go somewhere else.

Came here as a last minute stop before we left Vegas. The food wasn't amazing nor horrible. The workers were nice and weren't annoying like the other asian cart ladies who try to bribe you to eat more. The lights gave the place an uncomfortable feel. Overall, Harbor Palace wasn't the best dim sum place that I've been to.

Went here with a party of 10. From the outside restaurant looks nice but from the inside looks old and dingy. The first red flag was the table cloth on our table. It was filthy. Food stains all over it. The food too a really long time to come out. At least 30 min before we received any food. For a Chinese restaurant that's a long time. Last time we will ever be back.

it was nearly 6 oclock and the restaurant was empty.   they gave a lot of food for the food. couple of the dishes were salty and filled with MSG. although i must agree that there was a couple other dishes that were pretty decent.    quick review, i'll revisit when i have time

This restaurant is located in Chinatown at the end of the plaza. We woke up pretty late that Saturday so dim sum was already over. We asked if they can still make it and they said they would. Great! Now we can enjoy Dim sum! After ordering, we realize that they kept bringing over the leftover dim sum for us. So we decided as hungry as we were we might as well get something. The dim sum was cold. We then decided to just wait for our hot dim sum to come out. Finally some hot dim sum!!! We were so hungry we order more than we can finish. Im so glad we were able to still order dim sum so late in the afternoon. I have to say the service is really slow. It took a while for them to come around.
If you are disappointed about CUSTOMER SERVICE out of an ASIAN restaurant you need to get out more.  The food is amazing, they hardly speak English, but you never leave hungry.
JULY 27 2012 people go around in carts or u can order from the menu. The decor is ok. Overall this place is alright the food is not really that great. I would plan not to go to this restaraunt

When I visit Las Vegas, I come to harbor palace for quick dim sum for breakfast rather than eating on the strip. They're located in the beginning part of Chinatown from strip so it's very convenient and parking is plentiful.   This dim sum restaurant is spacious inside. They can hold many people and it does get busy during holiday season.   The dim sum is affordable and descent for what you pay for. All the servers are pretty nice and same staff as I have visited every year. And this is probably the only dim sum place that opens at 8am during holiday season.

I love, LOVE dim sum and my family and I have been coming here for over 6 years for their dim sum. Honestly I haven't found a place that serves anything better than this place. I gave three stars because their service is mediocre. It's impossible to ever get any ones attention and good luck with sitting the corner of the restaurant-- you'll have to holler at the cart ladies to even come your way.

It's hit and miss -- some dishes are good, and some are just ok. The atmosphere, appearance and cleanliness, or lack thereof are questionable. Given where it is, it's doable -- especially when you're in dire need to fulfill cravings for dim sum.

Went Easter Sunday for dimsum with our Chinese doctor friend and his precious family.  Even with 6 of us, we couldn't begin to try all the things I spotted.  I disagree with Keith (which is unusual), in that I thought they had enormous variety.  You definitely need to go with a large group of hungry adventurous eaters.  We had everything from  taro cake to shark fin dumplings, chicken feet, seaweed salad, crispy tofu -- tofu so many ways I couldn't keep track, simple things like eggrolls, dynamite dumplings of all shapes, sizes and fillings...we had chinese greens and bao buns that were to die for.  Our host explained that we should also order something from the menu -- he picked his favorite soup -- fish maw...but wouldn't tell us what it was until we'd tried it.  I liked it -- until as he suspected -- once he told me what it was -- then somehow it didn't taste as good anymore -- and I'm pretty adventurous...
